column2: Description

ASIC is seeking a full time Analyst, Regulatory Insights & Assessment to join their Regulatory Insights & Assessment team (RI&A).
Permanent position based in Brisbane, Melbourne, Canberra, Perth and Sydney.
Salary starting from $123,444 (plus 15.4% superannuation) depending on experience.
Hybrid working - enjoy 2-3 days working from home.
  A future with ASIC means that your work will contribute to ASIC's vision for a fair, strong and efficient financial system for all Australians. We value what you will bring. We value those with sharp, analytical minds and are open to challenging the way things are done. 
  The team 
Registry & Intelligence is comprised of seven teams - Registry Operations, International, Strategic Planning & Intelligence, Regulatory Insights & Assessment, Criminal Intelligence Unit, the Information & Knowledge Resource Centre and Business Improvement & Innovation. These teams drive an intelligence led regulatory approach using data informed insights and intelligence. The teams do this by assessing reports lodged with ASIC, manage information and data flowing into and created by ASIC and lead our international engagement.
The Regulatory Insights & Assessment team (RI&A) is responsible for the assessment and action of reports of alleged misconduct and breach notifications received by ASIC from members of the public and regulated businesses. The team is also responsible for the collection and publication of internal dispute resolution data from financial firms. 
  The role 
This role will be directly involved in the internal dispute resolution publication project, where you will be required to assist the development of policy and technical requirements for the external publication of internal dispute resolution data. You may also be required to undertake core RI&A tasks such as assessing reports, mentoring team members and process improvement.
As an Analyst, you will be accountable for:
Contributing to the development of public reporting of financial industry data reported to ASIC, including selecting appropriate data elements, presentation, and contextualisation.
Working in a project team as a business expert on the development of the design and technical solution for the public reporting of financial industry data, provide subject matter expertise, manage risks, and report to RI&A's management group on the project.
Working with data analysts to prepare summaries, reports, briefings, presentations, and data visualisations monitoring the status and quality of financial industry data reported to ASIC as well as to assist other teams make use of the data.
Contributing to regular updates of ASIC's regulatory guidance and legislative instruments covering financial industry data reporting by monitoring law reform, industry product or issue changes, and desirable enhancements to the reporting rules or guidance.
  About you
Relevant tertiary qualifications.
Relevant industry related experience gained in financial services, regulatory, corporate, insolvency, government policy, or commercial law environment. 
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple stakeholders and projects and take responsibility for outcomes.
Ability to analyse and provide advice on practices, policy and projects relating to the financial services industry and ASIC's regulatory environment.
Experience delivering results in a complex environment through a commitment to quality outcomes, managing risks, and the efficient use of resources.
Strategic thinking, analytical, investigative and research skills, including data analysis and presentation.
Conceptual, analytical, and problem-solving skills as well as drawing inferences from qualitative and quantitative data and to reach robust and practical conclusions.
  About ASIC 
ASIC is Australia's corporate, markets, financial services and consumer credit regulator. Our vision is for a fair, strong and efficient financial system for all Australians. 
A future with ASIC means that your work will contribute to achieving ASIC's vision. 
ASIC is an equal opportunity employer seeking people who want to make a difference. ASIC is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace where the very best talent in Australia chooses to work. Applications from people of all ages, cultural backgrounds, abilities, LGBTIQ+ identity, and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander decent are encouraged to apply.  
To work with us, you need to be an Australian citizen, and be prepared to complete an ASIC Suitability and Baseline Assessment which is issued by ASIC's Security team.
View the position description for more information or click ‘apply' to start your application.
  Applications for this role will close at 11:59pm on Sunday 1st December 2024.

Hybrid Working Environment
QLD location ideally, open to NSW or VIC
We’re never just satisfied with how things are – because we know how things could be. And it’s our expert Technology team who forge ahead every day to make those ‘what ifs’ a reality.
As a Senior Data System Analyst, you will play a crucial role as the liaison between business requirements and technical data solutions, with a primary focus on optimizing data-related aspects within our organisation. We are requiring a new Senior Data Systems Analyst in our Customer Platforms team. 
In this role, you will be dedicated to ensuring that data systems and processes effectively support our organization's strategic objectives and operational needs. As a key subject matter expert on data systems, flows, integrations, and analytics, you will possess a deep understanding of how data flows throughout the organisation. Your expertise will extend not only to the systems themselves but also to the context in which the business uses and leverages the available information.
Drawing upon this comprehensive knowledge, Senior Data System Analysts will guide technology deliverables to ensure that outcomes are fit for purpose and align with stakeholder needs. Your contribution will be pivotal in driving the optimization of our data systems to meet the evolving requirements of the organization.
  What you’ll do
Conduct in-depth analysis of business processes, identify improvement opportunities, and define requirements to address business needs
Manage and maintain a comprehensive set of requirements, ensuring they are well-documented, traceable, and prioritized
Lead and execute comprehensive testing of business processes, ensuring that they meet established requirements and performance criteria
Identify and assess risks associated with Data and Business Systems. Develop risk mitigation plans and work with stakeholders to ensure the successful management of risks
Analyse and report on business data to support decision-making processes
Lead efforts to redesign and optimize business processes.
Foster and manage relationships with key business stakeholders to understand their needs and ensure IT solutions align with business objectives
What you’ll bring
Tertiary qualifications in IT, Business, or associated field (Mandatory)
6+ years of experience in a data-related role, in a primarily analyst type capacity
Customer Master Data Management (MDM) experience & Strong Data Mapping skills
Proficiency in managing complex and detailed requirements through their lifecycle, ensuring alignment with business goals and technological capabilities
Advanced skills in data analysis, including complex data manipulation, statistical analysis, or predictive modeling
Expertise in analysing intricate business processes and workflows, identifying inefficiencies, and proposing optimizations or reengineering strategies
Mastery of Agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Kanban) and other project management methodologies for efficient and adaptive project execution
Strong leadership, strategic thinking, stakeholder management, and negotiation skills essential for guiding complex IT initiatives
What we can offer
A range of flexible working and leave options, including 20 weeks paid parental leave, 4 weeks paid secondary carer parental leave and unlimited paid emergency response leave
Discounts and offers on a range of retail favourite stores as well as banking and insurance products
Give back to our communities with payroll giving, donation matching and paid volunteer leave
Invest in your brighter future with ongoing study support and career development programs; and
Prioritise your work/life balance with our robust employee assistance program and dedicated employee council
Employee benefits | Suncorp Group

Job Opportunity: Full-Time Analyst
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and implement pricing strategies using mathematical and analytical methodologies.
Optimise operational processes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
Contribute to strategic decision-making through detailed data analysis and reporting.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive business growth and operational excellence.
Qualifications:
Recent graduate in business, mathematics, finance, or related field.
Strong analytical skills with a passion for numbers and data-driven decision-making.
Basic understanding of the banking or financial sector; keen to receive training and mentorship in fintech.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
Desire to grow in a fast-paced, dynamic fintech environment.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills; team-oriented mindset.
Entrepreneurial spirit

Our Business:
Established in 1993, and with three offices located in South-East Queensland including its head office on the Sunshine Coast, Devcon provides property solutions for a range of clients throughout South-East Queensland.

Driven by a ‘Built/Better’ motto, we specialise in the design and construction of residential, industrial and commercial properties throughout Queensland.
Your Next Opportunity:
Are you passionate about data and looking for a rewarding career in the construction industry? Devcon Building Co is seeking a dedicated Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. 
Ideally the successful candidate would have previous experience in a similar role. The role will be a full-time position, Monday to Friday, in our Buddina office.
Responsibilities
Using a variety of data analysis tools to interpret and report on data 
Proactively suggesting improvement in the company’s processes or approaches based on their findings 
Reporting on past events, issues and trends so that other employees can learn from them. 
Acting as a liaison between different departments within the company
Testing out new BI tools or analytics techniques to find better ways of analysing data
Creating and maintaining databases where needed within different departments
Developing systems and processes throughout the business and maintaining system integrity
Other tasks and responsibilities as they arise, and the role develops further                              
Requirements
Strong understanding of statistical analysis techniques 
Experience creating and using reports and dashboards in Power BI
Excellent math skills, as well as readiness to learn new mathematical concepts whenever necessary 
The ability to communicate complex information effectively in report form 
Familiarity with common software tools used for big data analysis. These include SQL databases, R programming language, Python, DAX and others 
Strong computer literacy, including proficiency in using spreadsheets and dashboards 
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team
Why Join Us:
Opportunity for career growth and development within a reputable construction company
Collaborative and supportive work environment
Regular company wide social events
 All suitably qualified or experienced candidates are welcome.  Salary commensurate with experience.  
If you feel you meet the criteria and would like to apply, please apply with your resume and cover letter via the attached link.
Only those successful in reaching interview stage will be contacted.

Risk & Compliance Analyst
Full-time permanent
  
Permanent Full-Time position available (9 day fortnight)
Lifestyle north QLD location, attractive benefits
$87,000 - $90,000 per annum + superannuation based on skills, qualifications and experience.
   Townsville City Council, the largest local government authority in Northern Australia, is dedicated to fostering economic diversity and creating an enriching lifestyle for its residents and visitors. With over $9 billion in community assets, including vital infrastructure such as water treatment plants, roads, waste management facilities, and sporting venues, the Council plays a key role in enhancing the region’s active lifestyle through events, recreational facilities, and environmental protection. The Council is committed to building a vibrant, sustainable, and innovative city that benefits both current and future generations.

As part of this mission, Townsville City Council is focused on delivering exceptional service and maintaining strong connections with the community. The Council’s vision is to create a connected, lifestyle-driven, and innovation-focused city that is shaped by its residents.

About the Role

The Risk and Compliance Analyst is responsible for managing risk and compliance across the Information Technology Services (ITS) division at Townsville City Council. This includes developing and delivering an annual risk and compliance program, conducting compliance reviews, and ensuring adherence to relevant policies and legislative requirements. The role involves collaboration with the ITS leadership team, internal and external auditors, and key stakeholders to support continuous improvement and maintain business continuity. The Analyst is also responsible for maintaining key ITS documents, including policies, directives, and emergency response plans, while ensuring that all activities align with the Council’s strategic goals and risk appetite. The successful candidate will benefit from the mentoring and support of leadership and their team.

About You

Tertiary qualifications in a relevant risk and compliance discipline
Minimum of five years' industry experience, including three years in a similar role
Experience in IT risk management (there is an existing Cyber Security team so expertise in this area is not a focus)
Knowledge of customer service principles within an IT environment
Familiarity with ISO2700x standards
Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret complex data
Experience working within large, diverse organisations
Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills
Ability to foster relationships with stakeholders, ensure compliance, and manage risk within the IT framework
   How to Apply

Your application can be submitted through the 'Apply' button on this website. Please include a cover letter (maximum 2 pages), outlining how your skills, qualifications and experience would allow you to achieve success in this role. We also will require your resume and copies of any licences and qualifications as per the key requirements of the role may be required in due course.
Previous applicants for previously advertised roles are not required to re-apply. 

For a copy of the Position Description please copy and use this URL:  https://tinyurl.com/ERRRCA

For more information or a confidential discussion, please email andrew@edenritchie.com.au or call (07) 3230 0018.

Closing Date:  12 noon, Wednesday 16th October, 2024.

About us

Ausco Modular is Australia's leading transportable hire and modular construction company with over 16 locations across Australia. We are an organisation that enjoys consistent and rapid growth, offering our employees secure employment, career progression and a safe work environment that encourages and brings out the best in our people. 

Your new role:

Working within our Finance Team the Data Analyst will assist in the economic and financial research and analysis for use in the development of new products, business strategies, and tactics. You will work closely with key Stakeholders to prioritize information needs, analyse results, and report findings to the business.

Additionally, you will be responsible for researching background materials, including relevant economic and financial data, as well as quantifying the financial impact of opportunities and issues involved.

Duties include but not limited to
Generate reports and construct complex data models.
Develop new data collection and analysis methods.
Interpret patterns in complex data sets, identifying trends.
Formulate strategies to enhance statistical result quality.
Maintain databases and contribute to long-term financial forecasts and budgets.
Optimize resource management for cost-efficiency, aligning with budget agreements.
Evaluate financial impacts, ROI, and payback periods for potential investments.
Ensure compliance with legislative requirements, company policies, and confidentiality protocols.
What you will bring to the role:
Degree in Business, Commerce, or a related field
Experience in Financial Accounting, Economics, or Finance (recent graduates considered)
Proficiency in Power BI
Advanced Excel skills, including macro writing.
High accuracy, numerical proficiency, and attention to detail
Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
Critical thinking and analytical mindset for data comprehension
Why us

At Ausco Modular we recognise there is so much more to our people than work so we have programs in place including flexible working so we can support you to realise your full potential.   We are a values-based organisation where the safety and well being of our people is our number one priority.  We also respect and celebrate differences so that everyone will experience a sense of belonging, contribution, and fulfillment.

As an organisation, we are committed to operating sustainably and in an environmentally and socially responsible way with various targets associated with a reduction energy and water use and waste.

If you are looking for a role where you can collaborate with your peers and leadership to help drive great outcomes for customers, please apply below
You must have the right to live and work in Australia to apply for this position.

We support diversity and strongly encourage Women and those from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities and defence veterans to apply.

Key Responsibilities/Accountabilities
• Develop current and future state process maps to inform and support the development of products and services.
• Identify and document business rules based on relevant legislation, organisational policies and procedures.
• Identify and document data input and output requirements.
• Analyse business processes and information flows and identify process improvement opportunities.
• Engage with stakeholders using existing channels and representative groups or establishing new channels to effectively capture user needs and obtain a deep understanding of business problems / opportunities.
• Identify and define measures that can be used to baseline and track both quantitative and qualitative business benefits.
• Identify change impacts and communicate to program and stakeholders.
• Produce artefacts to support change and communication activities.
• Work collaboratively with UX/UI and the wider team to define and improve the user experience.


Skills and Capabilities
• Well-developed analytical, problem solving and organisational skills with an ability to meet priorities, competing deadlines and use of sound judgement in decision making.
• Demonstrated ability to work as part of a team of people to provide consistent, responsive and high-quality advice and support.
• Excellent organisational skills and demonstrated experience working in a rapidly changing and demanding professional environment with proven capacity to prioritise, multi-task, achieve business goals, perform and always work with a customer focused approach.
• Demonstrated high level of interpersonal, negotiation and communication skills, both written and oral, including demonstrated ability to liaise effectively with internal and external key stakeholders.
• Openness to learning and takes responsibility for personal growth. Acquires strategies for gaining knowledge and learning new technologies and skills. Engages in learning from others both within and outside the organisation. Tries new approaches and broadens scope of work while learning from work assignments.


Essential to the Role:
• Previous experience (5+ years) in a business analysis or analytical role in a complex project environment is essential.
• Demonstrated experience in Business Process Mapping and Process Analysis experience using relevant Business Process Modelling Notation (BPMN 2.0).
• Demonstrated strong oral and written communication skills, strong skills in negotiation and customer management.
• Sound analytical and conceptual skills, strong attention to detail, a logical approach to problem solving and an investigative and inquisitive mind.
• Demonstrated inclusive, collaborative and engaging approach, including the ability to consult, facilitate, negotiate and influence with a broad range of stakeholders.

The Company
Martinus Rail is a 100% Australian owned and operated rail construction company working on some of Australia's largest rail infrastructure projects. We are a company that focuses on finding people who are the right fit into our company culture as much having the right skills and experience. We encourage learning, experimentation and out of the box thinking, and we know that fun is a vital element of an engaged and productive workplace. We value the importance of balance between work and family life and promote this philosophy throughout the company.
 The Role
We are seeking a Business Analyst to assist our high-performing team in Brisbane. 
 Key Responsibilities:
Financial Modelling: Design, develop, and maintain financial models to support decision-making, including budgeting, forecasting, valuation, scenario analysis, and performance tracking.
Data Analysis: Gather and analyse financial data to identify trends, anomalies, and key metrics that drive business insights and strategic recommendations.
Budgeting & Forecasting: Work with cross-functional teams to develop and refine budgets and forecasts, incorporating historical data and market trends.
Scenario & Sensitivity Analysis: Conduct scenario and sensitivity analyses to assess the impact of changes in variables on financial performance and project outcomes.
Reporting & Presentation: Prepare detailed reports and presentations, summarizing financial insights and recommendations to assist leadership in strategic planning and investment decisions.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate with various departments (e.g., finance, operations, Business Development) to gather data, validate assumptions, and ensure alignment on key business drivers.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities to enhance financial modelling processes, tools, and reporting methodologies to increase efficiency and accuracy.
 Required Skills & Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Business Administration, or a related field preferred.
Experience: 3+ years of experience in financial modelling, financial analysis, or a similar role.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Excel (advanced modelling functions, and BI tools (e.g., Power BI) is highly desirable.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and quantitative skills, with the ability to handle large datasets and complex financial models accurately.
Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to clearly present financial concepts and findings to non-financial stakeholders.
Attention to Detail: High attention to detail with the ability to spot trends, inconsistencies, and opportunities in financial data.
To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below. Please note agency submissions will not be accepted.

Discover Your Next Role
As a Master Data Analyst at Wilmar, you'll play a key role in managing and maintaining the integrity of high-end master data for our Plant Maintenance (PM) and Project Systems (PS) modules in SAP. This crucial function supports our asset management processes, ensuring system standards are upheld and compliance is maintained across the business.
This full-time position will be based in our tropical Townsville Office or at anyone of our operating sites across North Queensland, offering you the chance to live and work in a dynamic and supportive environment. You'll enjoy a collaborative team culture with access to excellent facilities and a range of benefits to support your career growth.
Your Role in Action
Master Data Governance & Integrity
Maintain and ensure the accuracy of master data for asset management in SAP PM/PS modules.
Govern and standardize master data processes, ensuring compliance with system standards.
SAP Configuration Support
Contribute to the improvement, development and configuration of SAP PM/PS modules to support business processes within across the business.
Collaborate with teams to resolve discrepancies between system design and user requirements.
Coaching & Training
Train and support site-based users in master data management best practices.
Share your expertise in master data governance, promoting consistency and accuracy across locations.
Process Improvement & Best Practices
Identify and drive improvements in data management processes.
Lead projects to implement new solutions for better practices, from development through to implementation.
Eliminate Redundancies
Remove the need for alternate engineering databases by improving and centralizing data in SAP.
People Leadership & Development
Mentor and manage the performance of your direct reports, supporting their professional growth and alignment with Wilmar's HR standards.
Your Winning Combination
Our ideal candidate will have 8+ years of experience in maintenance planning within an industrial environment, with strong knowledge of Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS). A background in master data governance and proficiency in SAP PM/PS modules are essential. Additionally, experience in coaching and training site-based users will be highly valued. A qualification in an engineering discipline or industry qualifications in SAP PM/PS master data management is desirable. Experience in the sugar industry would be a bonus, but not essential.
What Wilmar will offer you
At Wilmar, you'll be embraced as a valued member of our team, appreciated for your unique contributions. We offer competitive pay and benefits, including additional leave and superannuation entitlements and exclusive partner discounts. Our emphasis on safety and innovation creates a supportive work environment where you can thrive.
How to Apply
If you think that you are the perfect fit for this role, we invite you to apply online via Wilmar Careers before midnight on 02nd December 2024. Got questions or need a helping hand with your application? Our friendly People & Culture Team is just a call away at (07) 4722 1972. We look forward to receiving your application.
About Wilmar Sugar & Renewables
Wilmar Sugar and Renewables is Australia's largest manufacturer and exporter of raw sugar, and among the top 10 producers globally.
We own and operate eight sugar factories across the Herbert, Burdekin, Proserpine and Sarina regions and employ more than 2,000 people during the annual sugar production season.
We are one of Australia's largest generators of renewable electricity from biomass and one of only two bioethanol producers in Australia. We are also the largest sugarcane grower in Australia and a leading supplier of sustainable liquid fertiliser and stockfeed products.

About the Role: Are you a skilled Business Process Analyst with a passion for driving efficiency and impactful change? We’re looking for an experienced professional to join a collaborative team in higher education, focused on enhancing work-integrated learning (WIL) processes. This is a unique opportunity to streamline operations and make a real difference in a dynamic, high-impact project environment.

Project Overview: Join a team within the higher education sector dedicated to supporting WIL programmes, which provide essential real-world experiences for students. The team utilises InPlace, a system for managing WIL activities, and the project is aimed at system integration and enhancing the end-user experience for students and industry partners. The project addresses significant challenges around process inconsistencies, data quality, and system integration.

Position Summary: As a Business Process Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, analysing, and implementing business processes using BPMN to improve efficiency and the user experience within a higher education context. You will work closely with stakeholders, translating business needs into detailed process maps and supporting process enhancements through to successful implementation.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop and refine Business Process Architecture, creating detailed process maps using BPMN.
Analyse existing processes to identify inefficiencies and areas for improvement.
Facilitate workshops and meetings to validate process flows and gather stakeholder feedback.
Provide training and support to staff on new processes and tools.
Collaborate with project team members to ensure alignment between process development and technological updates.
Monitor and assess the effectiveness of new processes, recommending further improvements as needed.
Maintain comprehensive documentation of process maps and related materials.
About You:
Experience: Proven experience as a Business Process Analyst or in a similar role.
Skills: Strong knowledge of Business Process Architecture, BPMN, and process mapping tools.
Analytical: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Communication: Strong communication and interpersonal skills to engage effectively with stakeholders across the education sector.
Teamwork: Able to work both independently and collaboratively within a team.

Quick & easy payroll submissions & weekly pay
Salary Sacrifice

Contractor events
Novated leasing
Exclusive benefits through Flare HR

Our Company  
In 2023, HOTA joined Experience Gold Coast, which combines HOTA, Study Gold Coast, Destination Gold Coast, Placemakers* and Major Events Gold Coast in an exciting new chapter. 
Experience Gold Coast assumes a significant responsibility in growing the visitor economy of the city, with a clear objective of positioning the Gold Coast as the lifestyle capital of Australia. As a newly formed entity, Experience Gold Coast is focused on supercharging tourism, events, arts & culture, and education outcomes for the City of Gold Coast.   
 About the role
We have an exciting opportunity to become our next Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst!

As a Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst at Experience Gold Coast, you will play a key role in providing strategic financial planning and analysis support. This full-time position is based at HOTA Home of the Arts, where you will connect the dots between raw financial data and business strategy, ensuring that the team can can make proactive, data-driven decisions that drive the company's growth and success.
What you'll be doing
Preparing detailed financial models and forecasts to support business decision-making
Analysing financial data and providing insights to inform strategic planning
Assisting in the development of budgets, financial reports and presentations
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to identify cost-saving opportunities and improve financial performance
Providing expert advice and recommendations to senior stakeholders
Dive deeply into financial data and become a subject matter expert to provide additional insights
What we're looking for
Proven experience working as a Finance Analyst or within a commercial role in finance.
A LOVER of all things excel and data
Proficiency in financial modelling, data analysis and reporting
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Proven ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
Familiarity with financial planning and analysis software
Key Data and Excel skillset required
Advanced Excel Functions & Formulas -Vlookup, Hlookup, Index/Match, Sumifs, Countifs, Sumproducts, IF statements, Pivot Tables
Data visualisation - Charts & Graphs, Conditional formatting
Financial Modelling & Forecasting - Building models, Scenario analysis 
Automation and Efficiency - Macros, Data importing & cleansing 
Reporting and Dashboard Creation - Dynamic dashboards, data linking
What we offer

At Experience Gold Coast, we are committed to providing our employees with a supportive and rewarding work environment. In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a range of benefits, including:

• Comprehensive health and wellness program
• Generous leave entitlements and flexible work arrangements
• Opportunities for professional development and career advancement
• A dynamic and collaborative company culture

About the role 

Troocoo is proud to partner with a market leader in the building and construction industry, to find a skilled Technical Business Analyst to join their Product Team. 

Reporting into the Product Lead, the Technical Business Analyst will act as a conduit between the business and technology, as the organisation continues to enhance existing and develop new customised software solutions for the industry.

Technical Business Analyst responsibilities:
Partner with stakeholders across business units to develop analyses and documentation in a collaborative way, communicating effectively and efficiently with production, managerial, and executive teams
Evaluate, analyse, and communicate systems requirements on a continuing basis, and maintain systems processes, including the delivery of monthly status reports to all appropriate parties
Conduct systems analytics to maximize effectiveness and troubleshoot problems
Develop meaningful and lasting relationships with partners for optimized systems integration, and respond to questions and concerns from managers and executives with supporting research and recommendations
Partner with the development team in delivery of functional requirements for implementation
Ideally you will have a technical aptitude and excellent communication skills to act as the translation layer for the business. You will be skilled in data visualization, technical writing, and will be able to support multiple projects. 

This is a Sunshine Coast based position that may consider Brisbane candidates that are open to commuting. 

If you are heading into the end of year looking for a new challenge, and this sounds of interest, then I would love to hear from you! Please apply direct here or for more information contact Charlotte Boyes on - charlotte.boyes@troocoo.com.

The Opportunity

Our client is seeking an experienced ICT Business Analyst to drive the delivery of diverse project initiatives, with a strong focus on COTS/SaaS systems.



The Role

As a Business Analyst you will be responsible for gathering and documenting business requirements for assigned initiatives, ensuring alignment with business objectives. Your other responsibilities will include:
Leading workshops, facilitate outcome-driven meetings, and translate business needs into technical specifications.
Managing requirement backlogs in collaboration with system owners and suppliers.
Supporting the design, configuration, testing, and deployment of SaaS/COTS systems.
Coordinating user testing, software releases, and deployment activities.
Building and maintaining strong relationships with stakeholders to ensure effective communication and delivery.


About You

In order to be a successful applicant you will have extensive experience as a Business Analyst, ideally managing small programs or initiatives. You will also have:
Expertise in designing, configuring, and administering SaaS/COTS systems.
Strong skills in process documentation and translating business needs into technical requirements.
Proven ability to drive continuous improvement through process and technology change.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
Experience leading workshops, facilitating consensus, and coordinating testing activities.


Benefits
An initial 12 month contract looking to onboard before Christmas with a January start
Work in a highly engaging and collaborative team
Flexible working environment, with 2-3 days per week in the office for workshops & team collaboration
Please apply by upload your current resume in Microsoft Word format only (.doc or .docx). Want to know more about Davidson? Visit us at www.davidsonwp.com

Flexible working Locations
Hybrid Working Environment (WFH)
Bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions
We’re never just satisfied with how things are – because we know how things could be. And it’s our expert Technology team who forge ahead every day to make those ‘what ifs’ a reality.
Welcome to a place where you can chase real progress and drive real change. And that includes your own career. Being a part of Technology at Suncorp Group means being switched on, endlessly curious and always adaptable. In return, you’ll be supported to bring your own ideas to the table and challenge conventions – with the aim of making life a little brighter, simpler and better for our customers and each other.
We’re looking for an excellent Senior Data Systems Analyst with insurance experience who has exceptional data analysis skills combined with interpersonal skills to be able to engage and communicate with a variety of stakeholder groups across the Insurance domain at Suncorp.
This role will focus in on Statutory Insurance primarily requiring an understanding of CTP / Workcover. Ideally experience working on AWS and redshift.
  What you’ll do:
Conduct in-depth analysis of business processes, identify improvement opportunities, and define requirements to address business needs
Work closely with claims and insurance teams to document, analyse, and design data solutions that streamline processes and support digital insurance initiatives.
Lead and execute comprehensive testing of business processes, ensuring that they meet established requirements and performance criteria
Identify and assess risks associated with Data and Business Systems. Develop risk mitigation plans and work with stakeholders to ensure the successful management of risks
Analyse and report on business data to support decision-making processes
Lead efforts to redesign and optimize business processes.
Foster and manage relationships with key business stakeholders to understand their needs and ensure IT solutions align with business objectives
What you’ll bring
Tertiary qualifications in IT, Business, or a related field.
Duck Creek experience is highly preferred.

About the role
As the long-term investment manager for the state of Queensland, the State Investments team focuses on the future, helping deliver value to our government clients. We have an exciting permanent opportunity available for an Analyst, State Investments to contribute to the research program, to ensure the delivery of well-diversified and risk-controlled investment solutions to clients. In this dynamic role, you will work collaboratively with the internal QIC investment teams and will participate and assist in all areas of multi-asset class portfolio management including capital markets analysis, strategic asset allocation, tilting, portfolio implementation, day-to-day cash flow management and oversight across both public and private markets.
Key responsibilities will include:
Playing a key role in setting the strategic asset allocation (SAA) research.
Actively involved with the SAA process and ongoing execution.  
Developing and maintaining risk models for portfolio construction including portfolio stress tests and maintaining tools for portfolio construction.
Undertake research and develop tools to manage total portfolio outcomes including liquidity modelling, rebalancing strategy, risk factor analysis and portfolio optimisations.
Develop tools to simulate performance of asset allocation strategies.
Contributing to the development of models used to tilt the portfolio (valuation, momentum, cycle etc).  
Assisting with performance monitoring and attribution analysis of total portfolio outcomes. 
About you
You will have strong attention to detail and excellent analytical, problem-solving and quantitative skills.  In addition, you will have a passion for asset allocation and portfolio construction.  You most likely meet the below criteria:
Experience in multi-asset class portfolio management.
Exposure to portfolio construction and asset allocation. 
Ability to undertake quantitative analysis using tools such as Excel, PowerBI, Python, Matlab or Jacobi.
Solid understanding of methodologies and models, and familiarity with various asset classes and strategies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to collaborate with others. 
Experience dealing with shifting priorities and meeting deadlines.
Tertiary qualifications in economics, finance, commerce, engineering or other relevant field.

About The Role
The core purpose is to map business processes and customer journeys and use these to drive process and system improvements across the business in alignment with the wider organisational improvement strategy.
The role involves information gathering, data analysis and the creation of clear and accurate business process maps to identify opportunities for improvement and support change delivery initiatives.
  Position Accountabilities
 Information gathering, data analysis and process mapping to identify opportunities for improvement and support change delivery initiatives
Understanding business objectives and mapping business processes accordingly
Creating process maps and documentation aligned with the required standards and conventions
Effectively engaging stakeholders and facilitating workshops to gather and document processes
Working with change delivery teams to embedding changes into the organisation.
Analyse existing processes in comparison with improved or proposed processes to identify gaps and/or necessary changes
Conduct change impact assessment to identify impacts to other processes, teams or departments.
Providing process reviews and recommending updates to solve business problems and deliver business outcomes.
Assisting leaders to identify opportunities for improvement via data analysis and mapping, to meet organisational strategy objectives
Identify opportunities for improvement, support and change delivery
Work effectively as part of a change delivery team
Influencing and liaising at all levels of the organisation to support engagement and change management
Communication and Facilitation:
Excellent interpersonal, influencing and relationship management skills, with the proven ability to work at all levels of an organisation, and the ability to engage with diverse stakeholders and tailor your communication style accordingly
Superior written and verbal communication and presentation skills and a high level of attention to detail and accuracy
Demonstrated ability to effectively engage stakeholders at all levels of the organisation and manage upwards with confidence
Identify and report potential risks or inadequate controls related to compliance or operational risks.
Champion a culture of risk and compliance across the division
Maintain awareness, understanding and compliance with Company policies and procedures, including the on-time completion of mandatory training.
   What Experience You’ll Bring;
Demonstrated experience in business process analysis and modelling (BPMN) including As-Is/To-Be process mapping and data models.
Bachelor degree in a relevant discipline or commensurate industry experience.
An understanding of the General Insurance industry would be preferred.
Formal Business Analysis qualification (e.g. International Diploma in Business Analysis, IIBA CBAP or Lean Six Sigma certification) would be preferred.
A professional and “can do” attitude with a real passion for customer service.
Hand on, team focused attitude, ability to learn new systems quickly, experience of working to deadlines in a change driven environment and the ability to work autonomously while maintaining focus
Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project and Visio.  
  Our Perks
 Location – This role can be based either at our North Lakes or Kawana office.
North Lakes
Save the long commute to Brisbane and work for a growing company close to home and within walking distance to some of the north side’s best retail outlets, restaurants and other amenities.

Housed on the sunny coast and close to local retail, restaurants and other amenities, we enjoy views across Kawana Lake and we’re only five minutes from the closest beach. If you love the water and coastal life, this is the perfect place for you.

About the role

Develop and maintain database-driven solutions using FileMaker. 
Analyse and interpret data to create reports, automate workflows, and improve operations.

Assist with the optimization and management of database systems.

Results and task orientated 
Exceptional communication skills

About the Role
Reporting to the Head of Business Analysis, the key element of the Business Analyst role is to undertake detailed analysis of business and user processes, systems and requirements to support the scoping, design and delivery of projects within Indue and client systems.

Responsibilities for the role include: 
Drive the process of analysing, scoping and documenting user and system requirements for projects and products as required. This includes facilitating stakeholder workshops and client engagement.

Collaboration and involvement in pre-sales business analysis and provision of input into RFPs.
Manage internal stakeholders and external client expectations regarding technical system functionality.
Identify and evaluate compliance requirements and risks related to system capabilities and client requirements and develop appropriate control measures.

You are a flexible and positive team player, who enjoys understanding different areas of the business and developing solid working relationships that are built on a foundation of trust and delivery.
Your mature approach, ability to manage expectations and your appreciation of business pressures outside of your immediate area allows you to effectively assess and then implement enhancements in collaboration with your stakeholders whilst achieving key outcomes.

Formal qualifications in a relevant discipline such as Business, IT or appropriate relevant experience.

Experience in delivering one or more payment solutions and products
Experience in Cards payments related streams Card issuing, schemes, clearing and settlement, ATM/EFTPOS devices, switching
Experience in Cards tokenisation, mobile wallet provisioning, apple pay, google pay, Samsung pay
Knowledge of financial message standards like AS2805, ISO8583, ISO20022
Experience in NPP, RTGS, DE, BPAY, International money transfer, MT / MX
Experience in building and implementing Payments Fraud monitoring and AML monitoring
Demonstrated ability to effectively develop and manage varied client and stakeholder relationships and manage expectations.
Demonstrated ability to effectively elicit, interpret, analyse and translate complex business information from stakeholders into documented solutions.
Experience in Business process mapping
Intermediate to advanced level skills in the day-to-day use of typical Microsoft programs (including Visio, SharePoint, Word, Excel and PowerPoint).
Demonstrated experience in working on multiple projects with a level of context switching will be highly regarded.

  *A note from Auto & General to recruitment agencies: We politely ask that you avoid making any approaches or sending any unsolicited resumes to our Recruitment Team or Hiring Leaders across our business. Auto & General is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

About the Company. 
Troocoo are delighted to be partnering with this long established financial services company who operate with an open and empathetic mind and a personal tailored approach to the customer. We are all different living busy lives and they see their duty as providing services that complement and fit the busy schedules of todays world.

About the Role.  
The Commercial Finance Analyst will be responsible for developing a reporting suite that will help the business to make informed decisions. The Commercial Finance Analyst is a newly created role that will grow and develop with business needs and the individuals influence around report development. 
Gather and analyse financial data from various sources, including internal databases, financial statements, and industry reports.
Develop financial models and forecasts to inform business decisions and strategy.
Conduct market research and analyse industry trends to identify growth opportunities and potential risks.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including finance, marketing, and operations, to identify data-driven insights and recommendations.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and presentations to communicate financial insights and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Continuously monitor and evaluate financial performance and KPIs, providing proactive analysis and recommendations for improvement.
Assist in budgeting and planning processes, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives and financial goals.
About the Candidate. 
The Commercial Finance Analyst will play a collaborative role across the business, partnering with stakeholders and leaders to build and support the strategic objectives. 
CA/CPA Qualified. 
Tertiary degree in Finance, Business or Commerce. 
Excellent communication skills. 
Strong systems and modeling skills. 
Experience of supporting stakeholders and leadership team. 
This exciting new role within a growing and ethical finance company is well rewarded with a salary of $120,000 plus super, and an inclusive and engaging culture.

For more information, contact Nick Lemin on 0434 586 321 or by email on nick.lemin@troocoo.com

What your day will look like….
Each day, you'll dive deep into complex data, transforming it into actionable insights that inform critical business decisions. Collaborating closely with senior managers and the executive team, you'll analyse performance data to support business case development and service redesign. You'll regularly develop and deliver reports, dashboards, and visualisations, ensuring they are clear, relevant, and impactful. You'll also identify opportunities to streamline data processes, working with specialists to enhance data pipelines and improve workflows. Your ability to communicate findings clearly will help guide strategic planning, as you tackle business challenges, advise on next steps, and contribute to the ongoing transformation of healthcare in the Darling Downs region.
Let's talk about you!
Our ideal candidate will be someone who can inspire the following:
Compassion – you will engage with others and demonstrate empathy, care, kindness, support and understanding.
Integrity – you are open, honest, approachable, equitable and consistent in everything we do.
Dignity – you treat others with respect, display reasonableness and take pride in what you do.
Innovation – you embrace change and strive to know more, learn more and do better.
Courage – you respectfully question for clarity and have the strength and confidence to Speak Up.
Why Us?
Darling Downs Health's (DDH) region is a large geographic area covering approximately 90,000 square kilometres across Southeast Queensland. We are one of the largest employers in the region, with a diverse team of more than 6,000 staff. We deliver frontline health services across our 30 facilities and care for nearly 300,000 people, support the birth of almost 3,000 babies and perform more than 15,000 breastscreens.
We offer rewarding career opportunities across a wide range of clinical and non-clinical areas throughout our health service and pride ourselves on providing a work culture that values and respects diversity in the workplace. We also believe that all our employees should be treated fairly, with dignity and with respect.  DDH is committed to providing a safe, secure, supportive, and inclusive workplace.
Benefits!
Competitive wages, salary packaging and leave entitlements
A diverse work culture
Career development
Professional development opportunities
Education opportunities, Study and Research
Paid parental leave
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Discounted Private Health Insurance
Fitness Passport
Work-Life Balance, Variety and Flexibility
Generous Salary Sacrificing
Next step….
Applicants are to apply online and supply the requested documentation.
Find out more about us!
Work with Us | Rural
Work with Us | Toowoomba

Your new opportunity
Are you passionate about social policy? Join our team at Queensland Treasury and play a key role in shaping policies that impact Queensland's communities. As a Treasury Analyst, you will partner with Queensland Government agencies to resolve complex policy and budget issues, provide strategic advice to senior management and Ministers, lead projects, and manage crucial government processes. This role affords you the opportunity to apply your strong analytical, communication, and relationship management skills.
In this role, you will:
• Develop and maintain positive working relationships and partnerships with clients and stakeholders on a range of issues.
• Advise on strategic and operational matters, including public policy, legislation and regulation, program implementation, performance monitoring and evaluation, financial management and accounting policy, and/or risk assessment and management.
• Support budget planning and performance monitoring of government agencies.
• Prepare reports, submissions, briefing notes, commentary, presentations, and correspondence.
• Support the organisational strategy, direction, and initiatives.
What experience you will bring:
• Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills.
• Strong research and analytical skills.
• Experience in government policy or financial reporting or similar analytical roles.
• An ability to work as part of a team and work independently on complex, time-sensitive tasks.
Whilst there are no mandatory qualifications needed for this role, however, relevant qualifications are highly regarded.
How to apply
To submit your application, click on the Apply link to provide:
• Your resume detailing relevant experience
• A cover letter of no more than two pages outlining why you are interested in this position and how your knowledge, skills and experience in relation to the Key Responsibilities makes you a strong candidate for the role.
We welcome applicants to share with the hiring manager any health condition, disability, and/or cultural or linguistic background, so that we may make any necessary adjustments to enable you to equitably participate in the recruitment process.
Applications to remain current for 12 months
Job Ad Reference: QLD/603307/24
Closing Date: Friday, 22 November 2024

Business growth has created the opportunity for high performing individuals looking for a challenge, to join a team of capable, dedicated professionals in the role of M&A Analyst. Sunshine Coast location.
 Note:  A key aspect in shortlisting for this role will be determining how well applicants follow instructions for application (please see below).
 The Organisation
Divest Merge Acquire (DMA) is a leading M&A Advisory firm specialising in business sales and acquisitions to strategic buyers in the $3M-$100M+ value range. DMA operates nationally in a global marketplace, with strong systems and technology, has an extensive database and a broad referral network. DMA has been operating for 25 years and consistently ranks in the top 5 in Australia’s M&A mid-market. The business is also the exclusive Australian member of Corporate Finance International – a global M&A group with 27 offices in 19 countries. 
 Opportunity to:
Join a leading professional M&A advisory team
Be involved in interesting, complex and challenging projects
Provide support on M&A projects for businesses in the $3M-$100M+ value range
 DMA provides comprehensive training and mentoring to help you become a key team member on transactions, including processing and analysis of client financials, assistance with preliminary pricing strategies, assisting with due diligence processes and data room management and other ad-hoc analysis work.
 What you will be doing
Preparation of comprehensive client financial analysis including:
Detailed P&L analysis
Working Capital analysis
Earnings multiple pricing analysis & strategy
Offer analysis
Liaise with clients & other professionals in M&A transactions
Facilitate and manage data rooms for due diligence
 Required
Be a fast learner who thrives in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment
Have strong interpersonal skills and a desire to become an integral part of a diverse and social team
Be on the path to advanced skills in MS Excel, MS Word, SharePoint, Outlook and related applications
Strive to continuously improve knowledge through ongoing professional development
Be confident in interacting with clients and other professionals’ in meetings, phone calls and via email with support from team members
Have some experience (3 to 5 years minimum) in an accounting/finance role
Knowledge and understanding of the financial services industry
 Preferred 
Qualified or partially qualified within a business-related discipline – preferably accounting
Ability to interpret financial statements
 How To Apply
If you think you’re up to the challenge and want to explore this outstanding opportunity, please email your resume and cover letter addressing your experience against the key requirements listed above to kerri.barnsley@divestma.com.
 A key aspect in shortlisting for this role will be determining how well applicants follow instructions for application.

Position Description: Business Analyst
About the role
The Business Analyst position is responsible for providing Family Services Australia (FSA) with a range of data, projects and initiatives to analyse and immerse themselves in engineering workflows to identify inefficiencies and opportunities in improving our service stream’s reports and outputs. You will be responsible for bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions, while providing innovative improvements.
Key accountabilities include:
Requirements Gathering: Create and lead business analysis efforts for complex projects, focusing on process mapping, business improvement, requirements gathering, and translate them into functional specifications
Business Process Analysis: Conduct and facilitate in-depth analysis of current business processes, identify areas for improvement, and develop actionable recommendations
Ideation: Facilitate brainstorming and ideation sessions using design thinking methods to generate creative solutions that address FSA’s needs
Team Support and Collaboration: Collaborate with business stakeholders, various IT teams and foster cross-team collaboration to help team members complete relevant tasks and produce deliverables
Benefits
Remuneration negotiable based on qualifications, skills, experience and value-add
Professional, community-focused and person-centred team culture
Flexible location of work, with candidates able to operate from our QLD sites, or NSW HQ in Shellharbour
Flexibility around work from home arrangements
Annual Training, Learning and Development Plan including a generous yearly CPD budget
Salary Sacrifice Packaging $15,900 tax free
Employee Assistance Program (EAP) and Rostered Days Off (RDOs)
Paid Annual Family Days at Easter and Christmas
Essential criteria
Demonstrated 3+ years’ recent experience as a Business Analyst or similar role
Extensive expertise in Power platforms (BI, Automate, Apps), Fabric and other MS Developer tools
Experience in developing process flows, process mapping, wireframing, procedures and policy documentation
Advanced knowledge of the Microsoft 365 Suite (SharePoint, Excel, Word, etc.)
Experience with business system and process analysis with a strong systems mindset including all aspects of the solutions development lifecycle
Proven track record of developing and implementing successful outcomes
Highly proactive and willingness to take the initiative of autonomously obtaining the information required to deliver, monitor and evaluate outcomes
High degree of analytical and problem-solving capability with exceptional attention to detail and the ability to translate complex information into clear, actionable insights
Establish and maintain relationships with appropriate stakeholders (including vendors, external stakeholders, staff members), providing daily contact on status and changes
Proven expertise in utilising business analysis techniques and tools to facilitate workshops, gather requirements, and document processes
Ability to learn fast and develop a working knowledge for various online platforms
Desirable criteria
Creating user documentation, along with conducting formal training classes
Experience in the not-for-profit (NFP) sector with a focus on customer experience (CX) and/or product innovation
Direct experience in an Employment Services industry that has included successful, cohesive, and supportive engagement with teams
Experience undertaking Project Management duties
Developing project artefacts such as business case, scoping documents, user stories and test scenarios
Ability to plan, coordinate and support testing efforts, including user acceptance testing (UAT), to validate the implemented solutions effectively address business needs
Proven capabilities in requirements elicitation and documentation as per BABOK, process engineering/reengineering, and business change management frameworks
Proven leadership in process automation, system migration, and API testing initiatives
Ability to attend various offices across multiple states and work from home, as required
About Family Services Australia (FSA) www.familyservices.org.au
Join a dynamic Not for Profit (NFP) ranked eighth (Australia and New Zealand) in the Australian Financial Review (AFR) Most Innovative Companies – NFP, Government and Education sectors.
FSA is at an exciting time in its evolution as a leading NFP community service provider in Australia. Our Employee Satisfaction (ESAT) is at 87.1%, while Client Satisfaction (CSAT) is currently at 92.8% across our service streams.
Founded in 1992, FSA continues to grow its multi-disciplined services within Australia, having expanded from 2 to 35 sites across SE/SW QLD, Northern and Southern NSW. Our community reach impact has grown from 1,000 Occasions of Service (OoS) P.A. (2016) to more than 156,000 OoS (2024).
FSA offers a clinically informed central triage and continuity of care with reduced referral pathways that holistically meet therapeutic needs of our staff, clients and families, keeping them Safe, Well, Strong and Connected.
FSA values diversity in managing and reducing therapeutic risks for the clients we service, demonstrating values of Compassion, Accountability, Respect, Empowerment (CARE) with Integrity and Positivity. We make CARE our Intellectual Property, starting within, prioritising self-love, self-care and balance.
If you are committed to achieving this exciting life and career opportunity in joining our family at work, please forward a current resume, cover letter and address the selection criteria. 
As an organisation we celebrate our diversity and welcome all people regardless of ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation and gender identity. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people from a diverse cultural background are encouraged to apply.
For any initial inquiries please contact Chelsea Harvey, HR & Recruitment Consultant on 0437 029 058 or email at chelsea.harvey@familyservices.org.au.
Thank you sincerely for your consideration, we greatly appreciate your interest in FSA and advise only final preferred candidates will be contacted for next steps in our

About the Role:
We’re looking for a Sales Support and Data Analyst to join our team and provide essential support to the sales department. In this role, you’ll analyse data, identify key trends, and make recommendations to improve team performance. This role suits someone who can work independently, has a strong eye for detail, and is focused on creating more efficient processes.
Key Responsibilities:
•⁠  ⁠Support the Sales Team Leader and sales department with administrative and data tasks.
•⁠  ⁠Analyse data to identify trends and provide actionable insights.
•⁠  ⁠Develop and recommend strategies to improve team performance.
•⁠  ⁠Implement efficient solutions to meet team objectives.
•⁠  ⁠Complete tasks quickly and accurately, managing multiple priorities.
About You:
•⁠  ⁠Exceptional at analysing data insights, with a proven ability to identify meaningful patterns and trends.
•⁠  ⁠Skilled at translating complex data into actionable strategies that drive performance.
•⁠  ⁠Highly self-motivated, capable of working independently, and adept at managing unique responsibilities.
•⁠  ⁠Able to perform efficiently and maintain high accuracy in a fast-paced environment.
•⁠  ⁠Committed to continuously improving processes and achieving team goals.
Why Join Us?
Benefits: Free food/drinks on shift
•⁠  ⁠Work with a supportive team and grow your skills.
•⁠  ⁠Make a direct impact by helping the team succeed.
•⁠  ⁠Flexible shift patterns, great benefits, and a positive workplace.
Schedule: 10-15 hours P/W
If this sounds like the right fit, we’d love to hear from you!
For any queries, don’t hesitate to contact reception on 07 3132 8715 :)

Who We Are
SunPork Group is dedicated to delivering the finest quality fresh Australian pork to market. We are proud to be the largest Australian farmer owned and operated producer of quality Australian pork products. Employing 1,500+ employees across 52 locations in Australia and NZ.
Our people are the heart of our business, and we’re confident you won’t find a more committed and passionate bunch, as our dedicated workforce is a reflection of the quality you see every day on Australian plates. 
 About the role

This is an exciting full-time opportunity for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join the team, working from our Eagle Farm corporate office.  As the Business Intelligence Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting the company's strategic decision-making by providing data-driven insights to drive business performance and growth.
 What you'll be doing
Analyse complex data from various sources to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for improvement
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into effective data solutions
Implement data governance and quality control processes to ensure the integrity and reliability of data
Develop and maintain reporting dashboards, analytical models and data visualisations to track key business metrics and performance indicators
 What we're looking for
Minimum 3 years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst or a similar data-driven role
Strong proficiency in data analysis, modelling and visualisation using tools such as Power BI
Excellent SQL skills for data extraction, transformation and reporting
Experience in interpreting and communicating complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and experience working with large datasets
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and deliver projects within tight deadlines
Tertiary qualification in a relevant field such as data analytics, business intelligence or information technology
 What we offer

At Sunpork, we are committed to providing our employees with a supportive and inclusive work environment. Some of the key benefits of joining our team include:
Opportunities for professional development and career progression
Flexible work arrangements and a focus on work-life balance
Comprehensive health and well-being programs
Employee discounts and other retail perks
 Interested?
Apply now via the link below.
 
At SunPork we believe everyone deserves a fair go and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences are valued. If you’re ready to bring your unique strengths to our team, we’d love to hear from you.
Applicants must have the right to work in Australia and our recruitment process includes a  pre-employment medical which includes drug and alcohol testing.

The Position
The Business Analyst will collaborate with Information Services and other Council departments to support the business by offering solutions that address their information needs from a broad and long-term perspective. They will also provide a comprehensive view of all Council business systems, data, and technology in order to manage, scope, and define deliverables within predetermined timeframes.
 Key Accountabilities
Processes are highly automated allowing people to add value and improve the customer experience
Revised processes match the culture that uses them which increases their adoption and effectiveness
Managers and users have confidence that proposed solutions are high quality and meet or exceed their needs
Managers and users are informed about progress and delivery of their solutions
Users get the training to develop competence with new solutions
 About You
You will possess a degree in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics, or you will have at least five years of experience in a comparable position. You possess a high degree of analytical and problem-solving skills as well as the ability to be creative. 
You are capable of working independently under general supervision, managing your time well, comprehending priorities and deadlines, and working as a team to accomplish a successful outcome. You have also demonstrated the ability to think creatively and solve problems and create new solutions.
Additionally, you have a proven track record of excellent interpersonal communication, knowledge sharing, training, and presenting skills, including the capacity to interact with audiences of all skill levels. 
You must also have a Current “C” class drivers licence for this role. – See a full list of the essential and desirable Selection Criteria, in the Position Description
 Employee Benefits
Monthly RDO
5 weeks annual leave 
15 days personal leave
Flexible working arrangements
Salary packaging opportunities for vehicles, rent,mortgages, electricity and gas
24/7 access to Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for you and your immediate family
Corporate wardrobe / PPE provided
Fitness Passport Wellness Program for you and your family
Professional development
A collaborative and supportive work environment
Opportunity to make a meaningful impact on your local community
 Our Council
It is an exciting time to be part of the Cassowary Coast Regional Council, our commitment to a shared set of values offers great experiences through the building of a dynamic and inclusive workplace and community culture.
Council’s 2021-2025Corporate Plan outlines the overarching vision for the Cassowary Coast region is ‘to provide great experiences, deliver value and create a sustainable future for our community.’ - One Coast, Cassowary Coast.
 Our Region
Nestled between one of the seven natural wonders of the world, the Great Barrier Reef Marine Park and the World Heritage listed Wet Tropics rainforest, is the beautiful Cassowary Coast Region. Consisting of coastal and hinterland communities with 30,000 residents across the major townships of Cardwell, Mission Beach, Tully and Innisfail.
 Apply Now
All applications must be submitted via the Cassowary Coast Regional Council website by 7.30pm Monday 25 November 2024.
 On our website, review further position information and submit your application via the Apply button for this role, ensuring you include:
Cover Letter(max 2-3 pages)and the reason you are the ‘best fit’ for this role
Current Resume showcasing relevant skills, experience and qualifications
Current Licences/Qualifications, relevant to this role
Successful applicants will be required to complete a drug and alcohol screen and a full medical to ensure their fitness to perform the requirements of this position.
 Any Questions
If you have questions after reading the information on our website, or you are having difficulty viewing the position online, please contact us: 
People &Safety, P: (07) 4030 2216 or E: recruitment@ccrc.qld.gov.au
 Cassowary Coast Regional Council is strengthened by diversity and we celebrate our inclusive workplace culture that brings great value to our organisation and community as a whole. We promote and apply equality of opportunity throughout our recruitment process and encourage applications from all sectors of the community. 
This includes people with a disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, culturally, religiously and linguistically diverse people, young people, older people, women, and people who identify as gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, intersex or queer.

Temporary Full Time position available up to 30 November 2025(with possibility of extension)!
GIVE US A CALL - Libby Sterling, 0418 428 608 would love to hear from you and discuss the role further.
Professional and personal motivators!
As a professional working within Torres and Cape HHS, your role in enhancing both staff and patient experiences is invaluable.
You'll work in diverse and supportive environments that offer attractive lifestyle opportunities and experiences and enable you to make a valuable contribution in small communities. These communities will help you grow, connect, learn and create life-defining experiences that will shape who you are as a health professional and a person.
Torres and Cape will give you a career with purpose, plus excellent benefits and allowances;
Base salary comprising between $4,651.70 - $4,982.80 per fortnight – you may be eligible for additional benefits – refer to Workplace benefits | Torres and Cape Hospital and Health Service
Competitive salary packaging: Generous employer superannuation contribution of 12.75% and salary packaging options Salary and benefits | Careers (health.qld.gov.au)
Generous leave entitlements including 17.5% loading on annual leave
Professional Development: Our training is recognised as some of the best in the world
Living within the Torres and Cape region means you will be able to enjoy: 
Immersing yourself in nature, from the outback to tropical rainforests, coral reefs and extraordinary landscapes.
Choose Cairns for your next career move
Short commute to work, allowing greater work/life balance
Rich Indigenous Culture

Follow us - Facebook | Instagram | LinkedIn
Discover more by reading the role description attached.
Torres and Cape HHS Values - Courage | Accountability | Respect | Engage
