Actuarial Analyst (Home Pricing and Underwriting)
About the role
Join our Home Pricing and Underwriting team as an Actuarial Analyst, where you'll play a pivotal role in leveraging advanced data analysis to make a significant impact. We're seeking a skilled professional with a strong drive and curiosity. In this position, you'll apply your extensive knowledge of the actuarial control cycle to optimise our home portfolio, enhancing both growth and profitability.
Your responsibilities will include applying actuarial principles to tackle critical business challenges, driving value creation, reducing costs, improving efficiency, and implementing best practices. You'll actively contribute to developing effective and profitable rating and underwriting strategies.
We value individuals who are proactive, resourceful, and eager to continuously expand their knowledge.
Become part of our close-knit team, where you'll gain visibility and enjoy learning opportunities that accelerate your growth. Thrive in a supportive environment where your contributions truly make an impact.
Ways of working
This role can be based either at our Sunshine Coast headquarters or in Fortitude Valley, with a hybrid work model that includes in-office presence from Tuesday to Thursday at your chosen location.
Key priorities
Support the Actuarial function and company on insurance pricing and underwriting decisions through robust, accurate and timely data driven analysis.
Evaluate portfolio composition, trends, and deviations from expectations over time.
Compile and preprocess data for analysis, modelling and technical review of predictive claims models.
Present insights and recommend adjustments to rates to management based on model outcomes.
Implementing changes to pricing and underwriting systems.
Design, refine, and provide necessary reports for various business functions.
Collaborate with business units to ensure timely delivery of service levels for individual client underwriting referrals.
Contribute to the improvement of systems, including pricing and underwriting platforms, as well as overarching sales and policy systems.
About you
A Bachelor's degree in Actuarial Science or a related field.
Progressing through actuarial examinations viewed favourably.
Experience in an actuarial role (2+ years is a general indicator).
Strong knowledge of general insurance concepts.
Analytical mindset.
Strong understanding of sources of insurance data, its limitations and common uses.
Demonstrate efficient and independent working with very large data sets.
Pricing experience is highly advantageous.
Experience in building predictive models viewed favourably (e.g. GLM, machine learning).
Proficiency in languages such as Python, R, SQL, SAS.
Ability to collaborate effectively within a team.
Meticulous attention to detail.
Strong problem-solving abilities.
Effective communication skills.
How to apply
We would love the opportunity to get to know you better, but we know it works both ways. Get to know a little more about us at youi.com.au and click "APPLY NOW" to take that next step. 
Youi is a part of the Circle Back Initiative, and we commit to responding to every application via our Talent Management Software.
Our Internal Talent Acquisition team exclusively manages all hiring processes, and we do not accept unsolicited resumes directed to hiring managers.
About Youi
At Youi, we don't believe in conforming to the status quo. We're not your typical insurance company - and that goes for our approach to both selling insurance and hiring our team. With over 2,300 employees, we have ambitious goals to keep growing and continue delivering awesome insurance solutions across new products and distribution channels.
We pride ourselves on our diversity and individuality, both among our employees and the customers we serve. We believe that it is the unique combination of skills, perspectives, and experiences of our people that makes us truly stand out.
Our company values reflect this - we are a dynamic, human-focused, honest, and passionate team who provides awesome service to our customers. We recognise and value the contributions of each team member to our culture and success.
At Youi, we're not afraid to be different, and we're looking for people who share our values and want to be part of a team that is making a difference in the insurance industry.

About the Role

Hastings Deering is on the hunt for a Supply Planning Analyst to join our award-winning team in Archerfield, Brisbane. This is a permanent, Monday to Friday role.

As a Supply Planning Analyst you will:
Execute the procurement of parts to meet long lead time Sales orders requirements.
Provide support to Business Centre staff to source and expedite part requirements for critical planned work
Engage with internal customers to understand in detail inventory coverage deficiencies at Business Centres and execute the developed strategies to ensure adequate parts supply for planned work
Maintain effective working relationships with internal stakeholders and external suppliers to deliver optimal sourcing strategies
Responsible for executing supply plans for a variety of parts through a complex supply chain to meet forecasted demand
Action the outcomes of the monthly root cause analysis of rolling order accuracy and forward purchase forecasts and constraints
Perform root cause analysis to supply issues in order to understand causes and develop in conjunction with the senior supply planning analyst appropriate corrective action plans to resolve/eliminate issues at their source
Examine order schedules to identify opportunities to optimise orders through adjusting supply plan, manipulations of orders (deferral, cancellation) and consolidation of deliveries

Why Hastings Deering?

Opportunities for training, mentorship, and career development specific to your role.
Competitive remuneration package and annual salary reviews
Work life balance through flexible working arrangements.
A supportive, diverse, and inclusive team spread across Australia and internationally.
Access to growth opportunities at a regional, national, and international level through our global Sime Darby network.
Dedicated programs and utilities to support your physical, mental, and financial health, such as our Employee Assistance Program, free health checks, and discounted private health insurance.
Employee discounts, rewards, and incentive programs.
Paid parental leave options
Salary continuance insurance
Free on-site parking

About Hastings Deering

Hastings Deering is one of the top 5 Caterpillar dealerships globally. We sell, rent, and offer support and parts distribution services for Cat® products across a range of industries, including resources, general construction, civil transport and commercial construction, power systems, government, primary industries and marine.

We have more than 3,500 employees across 23 business service centres throughout Queensland, Northern Territory, Papua New Guinea, the Solomon Islands and New Caledonia, with our headquarters based in Brisbane, Australia.

PURPOSE OF THE ROLE
The Sales and Service Continuous Improvement Team’s purpose is to;
Ensure delivery of initiatives with project & change management expertise
Work with the business to deliver problem definition and solution design with Business and Process Analysis expertise.
Enable every member of the S&S team to understand the skills and processes required to implement change successfully in the Business.
Deliver excellence in day-to-day operational support.
Reporting to the Sales & Service Continuous Improvement Manager, the Business Analyst will ensure the successful design and development of solutions for Sales and Service. This will include analysis activities for new business processes, new products and operational process improvements. The Business Analyst will need to define and document business requirements, model business processes, define & document IT functional specifications and coordinate user acceptance testing.
  POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES
The Business Analyst will work throughout the division and the wider business with a broad range of stakeholder groups to ensure below accountabilities are achieved:
Gathering system and process requirements and designing innovative solutions to business problems, which may involve:
Facilitating workshops and engaging with relevant stakeholders and subject matter experts;
Conducting field & desk research e.g. user/stakeholder workshops, interviews and onsite observations, user surveys, competitor analysis and web analytics;
Developing business process maps to ensure clarity around process for all stakeholders
Where IT system solutions are included, translating business requirements into functional and system / I.T. requirements and specifications, and briefing these into the IT department.
Delivery a quality outcome through the effective management of issues, change requests and testing, including:
Effectively managing any issues and subsequent change requests to balance the need for quality with cost and timeliness impacts;
Testing, including developing the testing and approval process, briefing the testing team(s) and ensuring that the solution fully meets original requirements;
Monitoring of changes post implementation to ensure success;
Contribute to project and program delivery by:
Actively managing artefacts, including user/ business requirements, sitemaps, wireframes, proposals, scopes and project plans;
Taking accountability for assigned deliverables and ensuring effective and transparent communication with the project team.
Build confidence with stakeholders, creating positive relationships and credibility by working collaboratively, through:
Investigating and measuring process-improvement opportunities and working with the business to recommend and implement solutions;
Supporting the continuous improvement culture by acting as a strong supporter of change ;
Remaining a positive and proactive contributor;
Networking with internal/external resources to bring best practices to the projects/organisation.
Ensure changes are effectively supported once implemented, including:
Policy, procedure and training material/user guides as appropriate;
Business process maps;
Reference material to provide clarity of system functionality;
Ensuring the Support & Testing Team have the necessary knowledge to support the change.
Any other reasonable duties, as required, to ensure effective delivery of changes across Sales and Service.
  QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
Tertiary qualifications in a related discipline
Minimum of 2-5 years' experience as a Business Analyst
Strong business process modelling, As-Is/To-Be process mapping and data models;
Highly developed written and verbal communication skills
Facilitation skills
Stakeholder management
Excellent interpersonal and relationship management skills, with the proven ability to work at all levels of an organisation
A superior level of attention to detail and accuracy
The ability to work autonomously while maintaining focus
Experience in managing and completing user acceptance testing;
Must be a strong problem solver, comfortable with complexity and ambiguity
A passion for the User Experience
PROFESSIONAL COMPLIANCE & ELIGIBILITY
Well developed and demonstrated understanding of the legislative, regulatory and compliance obligations to operate in the FSR environment.
Our Perks
Location – This role will be based at our Kawana office - Housed on the sunny coast and close to local retail, restaurants and other amenities, we enjoy views across Kawana Lake and we’re only five minutes from the closest beach. If you love the water and coastal life, this is the perfect place for you.

Employee discounts - You’ll receive discounts on Budget Direct insurance products.

Onsite facilities - There’s excellent end-of-trip facilities on offer and private spaces for nursing mothers.
Get social - Join our vibrant social and community activities including annual celebrations, family fun days and regular events across each of our sites.

We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join the Enterprise Data Group – responsible for providing and supporting information and communication technology products, services and solutions.
  
The Enterprise Data Group within the Digital Division provides valuable services in relation to leveraging the organisations data to inform business decisions and support innovation.  In this area, the Business Analyst to be successful will require great communication, stakeholder management skills as well as technical understanding of existing SAP footprint (S4/HANNA) in order to support the business requirements to transition the data models and reports onto SAP Rise.

The position requirements are as follows:
  
Liaise with employees and management to translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications, especially matching business processes with system requirements;
Reverse engineer reporting requirements from existing report specifications. Identify information sets, source data and business logic or calculations applied and then document reporting requirements;
Work with business stakeholders and data analysts to elicit requirements and translate into user stories;
Identify information sets, source data and business logic or calculations applied and then document requirements in the form of user stories;
Undertake testing activity to ensure data analysis functionality (including visualisations) correlate with specified business requirements;
Undertake functional testing activities related to the development and implementation of the platform;
Support project team/s to successfully deliver the project/s using contemporary tools and applications such as Jira and Confluence;
Ability to develop and deliver presentations that clearly articulate the issues and proposed solutions, in a dynamic / changing environment;
Create data visualisation mock-ups and reverse engineer requirements from existing solutions if required;
Demonstrate a personal commitment to health, safety and environment and support a diverse and inclusive workplace;
Compliance with all relevant Legislation, our client’s policies, procedures and practices as varied from time to time.

Licensing/Safety Requirements
  
It is a requirement of our client that any licenses, certifications or safety accreditations required to perform this role are provided for verification and currency before the resource may be engaged.
  
 Essential Criteria
  
Demonstrated experience working as a Business Analyst on an Enterprise Intelligence / Data Platform.
Demonstrated ability in building effective relationships with business stakeholders and ICT service providers with the ability to negotiate outcomes in a complex environment
Demonstrated experience working on projects that provide corporate dashboard and reporting solutions to Business units and Executive level management teams
Competent in understanding SQL and embedded business rules
technical understanding of existing SAP products (S4/HANNA; SAC)
Practical experience in project tools and applications such as JIRA, Confluence and SharePoint
Understanding of Project Delivery life cycle and Agile methodology
  
Desirable Criteria
  
Experience in authoring dashboards, reports and preparing presentations for senior audiences
Experience and knowledge of the energy industry with an understanding of potential future directions across the sector
Demonstrated experience working with regulated entities and an understanding of the compliance requirements, including reporting and provision of information to regulatory bodies
Competent in understanding Excel advanced functionality (as may be used by accountants and engineers)

About QIC

As one of Australias leading institutional investment managers with more than $100 billion in assets under management, we have a presence across four continents, seven offices and assets across global markets.

At QIC, we believe in shared value - where delivering strong investment returns can go hand in hand with doing good for our clients, people and communities. If we invest well, we will all do better together.

Life at QIC

We know that our people perform at their best when they feel a sense of belonging and are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work every day.  We provide a supportive work environment where everyone can thrive and feel valued for their meaningful contribution in delivering for the prosperity of our clients, people and communities.

Joining QIC, you can contribute to our employee led networks that champion our diversity, equity and inclusion strategy, which consists of five key pillars: Gender Equality, LGBTQ+, Accessibility, Cultural & Linguistic Diversity, and First Nations People.

Other reasons to join us:
Flexibility and hybrid options encouraged – certified Family Inclusive Workplace
Recharge leave - additional 3 days leave per year
Annual Fitness/home office reimbursement
Ability to swap public holidays for those of personal, cultural or religious significance
26 weeks gender-neutral paid parental leave
Financial study assistance and study leave
Community leave for supporting the causes you love
Development opportunities to extend, expand and enhance your growth.
At QIC, we welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, the LGBTQI+ community, people with disabilities and people from all cultural backgrounds. We have an equitable, barrier-free application process so please inform us of your accessibility requirements in your application or you can reach out to our Talent Team on 07 3360 3800.
About the role
Due to internal movement, a permanent full-time position has become available to join our Private Markets Risk team in Brisbane. This is an exciting opportunity for a candidate with real estate experience to join the QIC Private Markets Risk team delivering investment risk management solutions. Whilst this role is predominately focused on supporting the Real Estate investment team, in this role, you will also develop an understanding of QIC’s other private market investment classes, being infrastructure, private debt and private equity. 
Key responsibilities will include:
Reviewing investment recommendations and forming an independent view on the appropriateness of risks and returns. 
Ensuring appropriate reporting and monitoring of investment transactions across the QIC private markets investment teams.
Monitoring and escalating risks in investment processes including controls, segregation of duties, process design and erroneous/fraudulent activity.
Analysing independent valuations and challenging valuers on the appropriateness of assumptions and outcomes. 
Assisting with risk-related matters on new client mandates, RFPs, business development and asset related strategic initiatives. 
Ensuring allocation protocols are managed, adhered to and updated accordingly. 
Coordinating and leading the preparation of deal-by-deal mandate compliance and quarterly compliance requests.
Supporting private markets investment teams with reporting, policy development and implementation, risk oversight and escalation of breaches and incidents.
Assisting with the preparation of quarterly risk profiles and key risk registers and ensuring models are accurately classified and documented. 
Effectively managing investment-related Conflicts of Interest. 
About You
Experience in real estate and private markets is essential, along with excellent stakeholder management abilities.  You will have a passion for private market asset classes, sound judgment and strong analytical skills and it’s likely you fulfill the following criteria:
Tertiary qualification in either Finance, Economics, Business or Accounting.
Solid understanding of real estate valuations and development feasibilities.
Highly developed analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Sound proficiency across Excel and PowerPoint with a keen interest in PowerBI and Pitchbook.
High attention to detail, methodical and accurate.
Ability to meet deadlines, think independently and have an inquisitive mindset.

Flexible working Locations
Hybrid Working Environment (WFH)
Bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions
We’re never just satisfied with how things are – because we know how things could be. And it’s our expert Technology team who forge ahead every day to make those ‘what ifs’ a reality.
Welcome to a place where you can chase real progress and drive real change. And that includes your own career. Being a part of Technology at Suncorp Group means being switched on, endlessly curious and always adaptable. In return, you’ll be supported to bring your own ideas to the table and challenge conventions – with the aim of making life a little brighter, simpler and better for our customers and each other.
We’re looking for an excellent Senior Data Systems Analyst with insurance experience who has exceptional data analysis skills combined with interpersonal skills to be able to engage and communicate with a variety of stakeholder groups across the Insurance domain at Suncorp.
Your role will offer variety such as, projects and BAU activity as well as the opportunity to work with highly skilled Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Business Stakeholders and Technical Development Squads.
  What you’ll do:
Conduct in-depth analysis of business processes, identify improvement opportunities, and define requirements to address business needs
Work closely with claims and insurance teams to document, analyse, and design data solutions that streamline processes and support digital insurance initiatives.
Lead and execute comprehensive testing of business processes, ensuring that they meet established requirements and performance criteria
Identify and assess risks associated with Data and Business Systems. Develop risk mitigation plans and work with stakeholders to ensure the successful management of risks
Analyse and report on business data to support decision-making processes
Lead efforts to redesign and optimize business processes.
Foster and manage relationships with key business stakeholders to understand their needs and ensure IT solutions align with business objectives
What you’ll bring
Tertiary qualifications in IT, Business, or a related field.
6+ years in a data-focused analyst role within the insurance sector, ideally with exposure to digital insurance solutions.
Proficiency with Duck Creek, Databricks, and advanced data analysis, including data modeling and business intelligence tools.
Deep understanding of insurance, particularly claims processes, with a strong ability to translate complex business needs into data solutions. 
What we can offer
A range of flexible working and leave options, including 20 weeks paid parental leave, 4 weeks paid secondary carer parental leave and unlimited paid emergency response leave
Discounts and offers on a range of retail favourite stores as well as insurance products
Give back to our communities with payroll giving, donation matching and paid volunteer leave
Invest in your brighter future with ongoing study support and career development programs; and
Prioritise your work/life balance with our robust employee assistance program and dedicated employee council
Employee benefits | Suncorp Group
  At Suncorp we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected. We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating a diverse, accessible, and inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers.

Company description:

IAG is not only the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, underwriting over $AUD13 billion of premium per annum, we're also a tech and research facility, a hub for climate change experts and a centre of resilience design. We chat over coffee with customers, advocate for them in the corridors of Parliament and back them up in the community when life's moments hit hardest.


Job description:

Create impact as the Internal Fraud Intelligence Analyst.
Join the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand Insurance, so much more than you think.
YOUR ROLE
As the Internal Fraud Intelligence Analyst, you will process and analyse information and data related to corporate misconduct, internal fraud, bribery, and corruption matters in a timely and structured manner. In this role, you will provide tactical and operational intelligence support to generate insights, produce actionable intelligence, and help IAG fulfil its policy, regulatory, and ethical responsibilities.
You will apply logical, analytical, and systematic approaches to gather, assess, interpret, and verify data and other relevant information. Through integrating evidence, prioritizing options, and evaluating data similarities and differences, you will develop clear findings and conclusions.Your expertise in developing internal fraud detection use cases, along with your knowledge of data ecosystems, will be highly valued.
This is a permanent opportunity, and the role can be based in Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide, Brisbane or Perth.
ABOUT YOU

• Tertiary qualifications in Intelligence, Criminology, Social Science, Law, Data, or related fields.
• Proven experience in conducting intelligence assessments on corporate, internal fraud, bribery, and corruption within a dynamic, high-paced financial services organization or similar complex corporate environment.
• Skilled in managing sensitive issues and engaging effectively with both internal and external stakeholders and agencies.
• Excellent communication skills across all organizational levels.
• Action-oriented, results-driven, trustworthy, detail-focused, and resilient.
Applications close on Wednesday, 20 November 2024 at 23:59pm.
Joining IAG you'll have access to:
• Boosted superannuation with 13% as standard
• Up to 50% off personal insurance, including home and motor insurance
• A certified Family Inclusive WorkplaceTM
• Energy transition opportunities to help us be net zero by 2050
About Us

We're part of the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand. Together our family of brands turns the IAG purpose of making your world a safer place into action by helping, supporting ambitions and making insurance accessible.
We're guided by the knowledge and voice of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, businesses and communities. Collaborating on Indigenous-led solutions that enable growth, develop resilience and create meaningful change, and support the leadership development of our Indigenous employees.
As part of IAG, you'll enjoy a world of opportunity, growth and stability and work in an environment that celebrates all viewpoints shaped by life experiences and cultures. Together we're passionate about social issues, climate change resilience, big tech and being an inclusive workplace.
We're ready for you. Apply today.

Who are Alliance Airlines?

Alliance is Australasia's leading aviation provider, serving mining, energy, and government sectors with over 1,500 staff. Unique in owning its entire fleet, including 37 Fokker 70/100 and 44 Embraer E190 aircraft, Alliance holds top industry certifications like IATA's IOSA and the "BARS Gold" status. With operational bases across Australia, this locally owned company delivers world-class performance, setting the gold standard in safety and reliability
What's the role on offer?
Here at Alliance Airlines we like to promote from within and due to an internal promotion we are now looking for our next Trainee Flight Operations Performance Analyst!
Working 3 days a week and supporting the Senior Flight Operations Performance Engineer in managing and developing aircraft performance systems and data across the Alliance Airlines fleet as well as:
Analyse and produce aircraft performance data to maximize payload, ensuring compliance with regulatory and manufacturer’s requirements.
Conduct runway obstacle analysis and design Engine Out Departure Procedures.
Develop and implement new tools and technologies for aircraft performance data production and distribution.
Manage and maintain aircraft performance systems, including airport obstacle databases and performance software applications.
Analyse airport capabilities and new route payload/range for scheduled and ad-hoc flights.
Support fuel efficiency programs and assist with technical support for flight ops technology projects.
Who are we looking for?
Our ideal candidate will be have a passion for aviation or aerospace engineering, you may be a recent graduate or graduating university soon and want to dip your feet into the ever evolving airline industry. 
Holds a Bachelor’s degree in Aviation or Aeronautical Engineering (desirable) with experience in Aircraft Performance or Weight & Balance.
Proficient in Excel, with knowledge of Python or other programming languages to enhance data analysis capabilities.
Demonstrates a strong commitment to Alliance’s core values: Safety, Performance, Purpose, People, and Service.
Skilled in problem-solving and taking initiative, with the ability to work independently or collaboratively in a team.
Exceptional communication skills, with a knack for building positive relationships across all levels of the organization.
Highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to quickly learn and apply new skills.
What’s in it for me?
Novated Leasing for Employees – This enables you to bundle all your car running costs into one regular ongoing tax effective payment! Get more money in your back pocket!
Salary Packaging – Another option to get more money into your back pocket!
Discounted Qantas Club memberships!
Discounted tickets to REDS (QRU) Games and merchandise!
Discounted Hotels, Tours and Cruises - Qualify for discounts on just about every type of vacation you can imagine!
Does this sound like you?
If the sound of this role excites you and you have the skills, we're looking for we'd love to hear from you. Hit that Apply button and Verna will speak to you shortly.
Applications will close on Wednesday 20th November.
At Alliance Airlines we value diversity, equality and inclusion, we are committed to providing working environments where everyone is included and treated fairly and with respect.
We encourage people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent and people from diverse backgrounds to apply.
All candidates must have full working rights within Australia, only candidates with a right to work in Australia will be considered.

As a Service Support Analyst, your main mission will be to provide premium on-site IT and telecommunications support to meet the evolving needs of TMR and our partner agencies. Your day-to-day tasks will be crucial for the smooth operation of our department.
Key Responsibilities:

We Value:

column2:
We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Business Analyst with a strong background in engineering. The ideal candidate will have a proven ability to analyse, define, and implement digital transformation projects in the water, utiltiies, mining or oil and gas sector. As a Business Analyst, you will play a key role in driving innovative projects that integrate cutting-edge digital technologies to optimise the design, operation, and maintenance of utility assets.
  
You will work closely with technical teams, stakeholders, and external vendors to ensure that digital solutions such as smart grid technologies, predictive maintenance, automation, digital twin technology, and energy management systems are effectively integrated into business processes. You will be instrumental in gathering requirements, mapping out workflows, and ensuring that digital solutions meet both technical and business needs.
  
Key Responsibilities:
Business Analysis & Requirements Gathering:
Lead the gathering and documentation of business requirements for digital engineering projects, ensuring alignment with strategic goals and technical specifications. Work closely with stakeholders across the business to understand pain points, objectives, and opportunities for digital transformation.
Process Mapping & Optimisation:
Map out existing workflows and processes, identify inefficiencies, and design digital solutions that improve operational efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance grid reliability. Leverage tools like Business Process Modeling (BPM) or workflow automation platforms to streamline processes.
Digital Solution Design & Implementation:
Collaborate with technical teams to design and implement digital engineering solutions, such as smart grid technologies, predictive maintenance systems, SCADA upgrades, and digital twin models. Ensure that proposed solutions are scalable, secure, and compliant with industry standards.
Stakeholder Management:
Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including internal teams, external vendors, and government/regulatory bodies. Ensure that all parties are aligned on project objectives, timelines, and deliverables.
Project Management Support:
Support the project management function by tracking project progress, managing risks, and ensuring that deliverables are met within scope, budget, and timelines. Provide regular status updates and contribute to project planning and coordination.
Data Analysis & Reporting:
Use data analytics to assess the performance of implemented digital solutions, provide insights into grid operations, and identify areas for further improvement. Leverage tools like Power BI, Tableau, or similar for reporting.
Testing & Quality Assurance:
Work closely with quality assurance teams to test new digital systems and ensure that they meet both business and technical requirements. Assist in user acceptance testing (UAT) and validation of new systems before they are rolled out.
Continuous Improvement:
Promote a culture of continuous improvement by staying up to date with emerging trends and technologies in digital engineering, IoT, and the energy sector. Recommend and implement best practices to optimise digital transformation initiatives.
Experience:
Minimum 5-7 years of experience as a Business Analyst, with a focus on digital engineering or technology implementation in the electricity transmission or energy sector.
Strong experience with digital transformation projects, including smart grid technology, SCADA systems, predictive maintenance, and digital twins.
Experience with energy management systems (EMS), automation, and data analytics for grid optimisation.
Proven track record of successful delivery of large-scale digital engineering projects, from requirements gathering to implementation.
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Electrical, Mechanical, or a related field), Information Technology, or a related discipline. A relevant Master’s degree is a plus.
Skills & Competencies:
Strong analytical skills with the ability to solve complex business problems using digital engineering solutions.
Expertise in process mapping, business analysis techniques, and tools (e.g., BPMN, UML, etc.).
Familiarity with digital transformation tools such as IoT, AI, data analytics, and machine learning in the energy context.
Proficiency with project management tools (e.g., JIRA, Microsoft Project, etc.) and experience working in agile or hybrid project management environments.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate technical concepts for non-technical stakeholders.
Knowledge of electricity transmission systems, grid operations, and regulatory requirements is highly desirable.
Certifications (Preferred but not mandatory):
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or similar certification.
Agile or Scrum certification (e.g., PMI-ACP, Certified ScrumMaster).

Experience and knowledge of the Energy Industry desirable
6-months contract with the option to extend for 6 months
Newstead Location (2 days WFH)
The contractor working as part of the Customer and Market Program and will be an experienced Technical Business Analyst with strong knowledge of business analysis techniques to co-ordinate and support processes and resources to achieve the outcomes of assigned projects to satisfy multiple stakeholders and disciplines.
Manage scope for assigned products to ensure business expectations remaining in alignment with approved Program objectives.
Manage engagement with SMEs (both internal and external to our client) to gather, validate, and verify requirements.
Report on progress status in alignment with Program milestones, tolerances, and reporting channels.
Ability to work bi-laterally with testing teams and other project teams understanding test plans and systems, defect and triage processes, referencing business requirement documentation.
Assist with the maintenance of the project Requirements Traceability Matrix through to deployment.
Provide support in managing IT contractors and consultants (as required)

Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to develop and maintain project communication channels and facilitate collaboration and open communication amongst internal and external stakeholder groups.
Compliance with all relevant legislation, regulations, and our client’s policies, procedures and practices as varied from time-to-time.
The role is ideally suited to someone who has:
Five or more years’ experience in a Business Analysis role in large, complex environments including Energy Regulatory Market Compliance Projects
Maturity in effort estimation for business requirements documentation
Strong experience with staged approach to grouping issues and providing recommendations based on detailed analysis
Strong expertise converting business requirements into functional specifications
Strong experience defining business process models and information/data models including ‘as is’ and ‘to be’ utilising appropriate notations (sch as BPMN, UML etc)
End-to-end program and project delivery experience
Operating in a Program Delivery Stream under a matrix structure
Ability to engage with business and technical SMEs gather the correct information and critically evaluate requirements.
Proven experience in working with vendors to deliver customised solutions.
Proven experience in leveraging data to improve the customer experience (CX)
   Desirable Criteria
Experience and knowledge of the Energy Industry
Demonstrated experience working on projects leveraging a variety of development / delivery methodologies
Understanding of market systems and how they interact with each other.
Experience with the following system types: Customer Information Systems, Meter Data Management systems, Billing System.
Experience and/or knowledge from working with similar initiatives such as:
- Customer Information Systems
- CRM
- Meter Data Management systems
- Billing Systems

Understanding of:
- Market transactions
- E2E Customer and Market processes
- Customer job types
- AEMO market rules

About Us
Gold Coast Primary Health Network (GCPHN) is an independent, not-for-profit company, one of 31 Primary Health Networks established by the Australian Government. We identify the health needs of our local community, then fund and improve primary health services to keep people well and out of hospital. GCPHN is building ‘one world class health system for the Gold Coast’ and we know we can’t do it alone.
We Offer
Remuneration package of $59,521 - $69,190 + Super
Work-life balance with flexible and hybrid working arrangements
Salary packaging (Fringe Benefit Tax exemptions) up to $15,900 p.a. + $2,650 p.a. meal and entertainment (tax free income)
Exceptional organisational reputation with established relationships in primary health care
Additional benefits of 5 weeks annual leave per year, paid parental leave, plus annual CPI salary increases
Benchmarked 'Soaring' workplace culture, with a supportive and collaborative team
Convenient location at Robina (Gold Coast) with free onsite parking
About the Role
We are seeking expressions of interest from recent or upcoming graduates to join GCPHN as a Data Support Officer, commencing in January 2025. You will have the opportunity to work across various project areas, including (but not limited to):
Identifying and sourcing qualitative and quantitative data from a variety of sources to inform the Needs Assessment, quality improvement activities, research, and ad-hoc data requests
Performing data cleansing to ensure accuracy and consistency in datasets, rectifying data anomalies and discrepancies, and implementing data quality assessment processes
Maintaining thorough documentation of data processes, standards, and procedures
Analysing and synthesising qualitative and quantitative data
Assisting in the preparation and/or review of dashboards, internal reports, briefs and other documentation as needed
Assisting in maintaining project schedules and tracking deliverable dates
In return, you will receive invaluable exposure to the healthcare industry, along with support to build critical capabilities and skills to grow a successful career. You will also receive guidance from the broader department and Executive team.
This position is a full-time maximum term contract, commencing in January 2025 to 31 December 2025.
About You
We are seeking applications from graduates who:
Have completed/nearing completion of a tertiary or post graduate qualification/s in public health, epidemiology, humanities, social sciences, data analytics, or related discipline
Are passionate and committed to learning about the primary healthcare field
Experience in sourcing and integrating both qualitative and quantitative data
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an eye detail
Have developed strong interpersonal skills, alongside experience working with a diverse range of people within a team environment
Experience in the independent use of relevant software such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint (essential), and data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI (highly desirable)
Whilst not mandatory, knowledge of statistical analysis tools and techniques, such as SQL, Python, R, DAX, Power Query or others would be advantageous
People of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent are strongly encouraged to apply.

Your role  
As a Signals Intelligence Analyst in the Air Force, you’ll play an important role in turning electronic codes and radar signals into intelligence that supports exercises, operations, and missions. You’ll use cutting-edge electronic warfare technology and software to draw on highly classified material and reverse engineer complex signals into useful information. 
Your duties may include: 
Manipulating large volumes of data to map new and historical intelligence to a particular platform (e.g. aircraft).
Identifying and correlating other forms of intelligence and reporting to enhance confidence levels in existing intelligence.
Providing timely briefs and reporting to deployed ADF and allied platforms.
Identifying unusual activity.
Analysing technical intelligence to identify radars, and their capabilities and functions.
You’ll be paid from day one to gain all the skills needed with extensive on-the-job training, all while living an adventurous lifestyle and making a difference to Australia. 
Benefits 
Competitive salary package  
Generous superannuation  
Good work/life balance  
Career progression and development  
Supportive team environment   
Free medical and dental   
Job security   
Travel opportunities  
Salary  
Upon completion of initial military and employment training, you will enjoy a salary package starting from $79,555. 
Location  
Following training, you may be posted to one of the major Air Force bases around Australia, such as RAAF Base Amberley, Williamtown, or Edinburgh.  
Apply Now: 
Apply today and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.   
For this role, you must be at least 17 at the time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen, and have passes in Year 10 English, Science (with a Physics component) and Intermediate Maths. If you are not an Australian Citizen you may still be eligible to join the ADF if you meet certain criteria, please visit the ADF Careers Eligibility Page for more details.
Visit the link below for the full position description and detailed application requirements.
Air Force - Intelligence Analyst (Signals) (adfcareers.gov.au)

Davidson are partnering with our well-known client in the Queensland Government sector for a Business Analyst skilled in process improvement, stakeholder management, and data analysis. This is an initial 6-month Hybrid contract.

You will support the transition of existing processes into new systems, structures, and policies. Your role will focus on stabilising and optimising business processes across government frameworks, ensuring the seamless integration of initiatives.
Key Responsibilities:
Facilitating business improvement workshops to identify and implement organisational strategies.
Conducting process mapping workshops and data analysis to review current practices.
Developing and maintaining stakeholder relationships.
Identifying improvement opportunities and providing high-level advice on process design.
Leading capability building and upskilling others to support long-term improvements.

You are an experienced business process improvement professional with a background in government settings, adept at working with diverse stakeholder groups. Your analytical skills and proactive approach will drive positive outcomes.
Key Requirements:
Proven experience in developing business processes and improving organisational capability in government environments.
Strong stakeholder management skills, particularly within the Queensland Government.
Expertise in business process mapping and data analysis.
Ability to facilitate workshops and lead change management initiatives.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

column2:

The Business Analyst within the MRQ Program - Finance and Partnerships Stream will provide leadership in assessing organisational needs, designing effective policy and procedural responses, and providing change management support over the transition. The role will undertake current and future state assessments, with a focus on finance, asset transfer, and commercial and community partnerships. Documentation of transition arrangements to support asset transfer and business continuity will be a key part of the role.
The Business Analyst within the MRQ Program - Finance and Partnerships Stream will provide leadership in assessing organisational needs, designing effective policy and procedural responses, and providing change management support over the transition. The role will undertake current and future state assessments, with a focus on finance, asset transfer, and commercial and community partnerships. Documentation of transition arrangements to support asset transfer and business continuity will be a key part of the role.
The Business Analyst will support the change process as volunteer units transition from separately incorporated associations to revised financial and operating arrangements working under a government agency model. The role will require close collaboration with stakeholders, including project managers, technical experts, and other program team members, to ensure all documentation is accurate, timely, and meets the program's objectives.
The Business Analyst for the MRQ Program will report to the Finance and Partnerships Project Manager and work closely with the program team to ensure the successful delivery of all program documentation.
Please note this role is not a technical business analyst. It sits within the Finance and Partnerships Stream and is focussed on resolving business issues that require resolution and document development as part of the implementation program.
Responsibilities:
Lead identification, analysis and resolution of business issues to support future organisational effectiveness
Prepare documentation to support the preparation of Transition Framework Agreements addressing asset and lease transfer, ICT, commercial and community partnerships
Research, analyse and document solutions, and engage with internal and external stakeholders to ensure integration across project streams
Develop operational procedures, policies, manuals and guidance information (amongst other documentation).
Work closely with project managers and technical experts to identify documentation requirements and ensure all documents are accurate and relevant.
Develop and maintain a documentation schedule to ensure timely delivery of all deliverables.
Ensure documents comply with the program's governance framework and government documentation standards.
Collaborate with program team members to ensure all documents are consistent and aligned with the program's objectives.
Develop and maintain a document management system to ensure all program documents are appropriately stored, version controlled, and accessible to relevant stakeholders
Requirements:
Advanced analytical, problem-solving and stakeholder management skills
Demonstrated experience in transitioning organisations through changes in business processes and operating environments.
Demonstrated experience in evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements and improvement opportunities, and documenting solutions to meet business needs
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex technical and business information in a clear and concise manner.
Strong attention to detail and ability to review and edit documents for accuracy and consistency.
Ability to work collaboratively with stakeholders to achieve program objectives.
Familiarity with project and change management principles and methodologies.
Experience working in a volunteer based environment and/or in the emergency services sector would be an advantage.
Like to know more?
To submit your application, please apply online using the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Kylie Graham in our Brisbane office on 0439 210 202 or email kylie.graham@hudson.com, quoting Ref No. 241346.

column2:
Multiple 12 month fixed term contract opportunities!
Full time (38 hours per week) and hybrid work conditions - home and office 
Excellent team environment and exciting projects to impact
About the roles 
It’s an exciting time to be a Business Analyst at People First Bank!  Our team of Business Analysts are at the forefront of shaping the creation of a new bank by working on concurrent exciting and complex projects across a multi divisional portfolios of work. 
We will be offering opportunities across our exciting projects including:
Lending
Payments, Cards & Fraud
Digital Banking Platforms
Complex migration projects
Payroll & HRIS
Salesforce
You will partner with stakeholders to support transformational projects.  You will undertake Business Analyst activities that ensure business requirements are well documented and appropriately managed throughout project life cycles. Additionally, as a Senior Business Analyst, you will drive the Community of Practice maturity across the team whilst providing support, guidance and leadership to Business Analysts. 
About you 
As a successful Senior Business Analyst with experience in banking or financial services, you have a proven ability to build and maintain exceptional relationships with stakeholders.  You have a particular strength in your communication skills which allows you translate technical data to non technical audiences and you have experience guiding a specialist team.
We also seek: 
Formal tertiary qualifications in IT, Business or Project Management 
Experience in requirements management, utilizing both Waterfall and Agile methodologies. 
Completion of Analyst Certification such as BABOK 
Candidates who have Lean Six Sigma and/or PRINCE2 qualifications will be highly regarded.
Why you’ll love working with us:
People First Bank – our new brand – says exactly what we’re all about: people. We're committed to supporting and growing our team and creating an outstanding work environment.
You’ll have access to financial and lifestyle benefits to support your success and individuality:
Flexibility and hybrid working arrangements.
Enhance your salary with discounts on banking, health insurance, and shopping across Australia.
Advance your career with training, study support, and project opportunities.
Competitive leave benefits that empower employees to take time for themselves and loved ones.
Wellbeing support with our Employee Assistance Program, wellbeing leave, mental health app, and mental health ambassadors’ program.
Make a difference with paid volunteering, Workplace Giving, and diverse community initiatives.
Be recognised for your contributions through our peer-driven recognition program.
A bit about People First Bank: 
In March 2023, People’s Choice and Heritage Bank merged to form Heritage and People’s Choice Limited - Australia's leading mutual bank.  We are now on an exciting journey to bring together our products, services, and technology under a single brand - People First Bank.
We have over 700,000 members and 1,900 employees, with dual head offices in Adelaide and Toowoomba, an Australian-based contract centre and branches across five states. 
With a vision ‘To deliver positive change through banking’, People First Bank serves members and contributes to the community, while offering an inclusive, flexible work environment. We’re big enough to make an impact; but agile enough to influence and do interesting work.
Apply online now:
If you are ready to join a supportive team who are passionate about the work they do and the results they achieve, then apply now. 
We are committed to diversity and inclusion and support candidate requests for adjustments to enable everyone to equitably participate in our selection process.

Who are we?
Fintech providing consumer, business and vehicle finance to our clients nationwide.
We are a leading Australian finance company on Trust Pilot thanks to thousands of happy clients giving us a 5 star rating:   https://au.trustpilot.com/review/safefinancial.com.au
We have a positive, target focused culture in a fast paced and vibrant environment and are searching for our new team member to be based in our modern Southport Office.
Position Overview:
Safe Financial is seeking an experienced Systems Analyst to join our team. 
We have a long standing, highly experienced small team of locally based developers. 
We are now looking for a full time Systems Analyst to join our team - helping us manage our technology journey so that we can continue to be progressive and efficient and our existing developers can focus on writing code. 
This role is ideal for a dynamic individual who not only has experience in software development but also excels at collaborating with all stakeholders (technical and non technical) and planning and leading a team to integrate emerging technologies and deliver on business requirements.
You will play a crucial part in driving technology benefits into the business as this role involves both hands-on development and team leadership, with a focus on maintaining, modernizing and enhancing our systems.
Leadership and Management: 
Provide leadership to guide our business on technology and development while understanding the importance of best practices and high-quality code delivery.
Collaborate with current team on the design and architecture of our core business system with the existing .NET codebase, taking ownership of its future stability, scalability, and maintainability by defining the product strategy and roadmap.
Collaborate with all stakeholders from Sales, Marketing, Operations, Compliance and Development (internal) and Suppliers, Partners (external) to solve challenges while fostering an environment of innovation and continuous improvement.
Set the technical direction for the group and ensure the team stays aligned with project goals, driving technical excellence in every phase of development.
Interpret business requirements and develop the most appropriate technical roadmap for evolving needs using modern and future focused tools and approaches.
Schedule, manage and work with external providers on projects including large scale data analysis and scoring model updates.  
 Technology Integration and Innovation: 
Drive the integration of new and emerging technologies, including being open to areas such as low code development, AI automation and data platforms for certain projects. 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and implement supportable and future focused technical solutions.
Work with existing team on change and release management processes with formal planning and documented testing.
 System Development and Maintenance: 
Develop and enhance data communication between core system and other back-office systems.
Work with existing team on the design, development, and maintenance of Websites and APIs, ensuring efficient and secure data flow across platforms.
Lead the transition from legacy systems to modern architectures, ensuring seamless integrations.
 Essential Technical Skills and Experience:
Experience in managing and undertaking .Net code development version 4 to 8
Extensive experience in application security and cloud native application architecture.
Experience with REST API interfaces.
A proven track record in SQL architecture design for mid to large scale applications.
Solid Understanding of user experience design and a preference to create distributed architecture.
A preference to document code as you go.
A can-do attitude and the ability to solve problems on the fly.
The ability to lead a team to work autonomously, but with appropriate coordination and prioritisation.
Strong knowledge of Visual Studio/VS Code and familiarity with the latest development tools and environments.
Extensive experience using Git for version control and collaborative development.
10 + years’ experience in software development using .NET and Entity Framework Core
10 + years’ experience in SQL Server data administration.
Practical knowledge of Angular (2+) for modern web and backend development.
Experience with Azure cloud platform 
Exposure to machine learning, data analysis and modelling. 
Exposure to the latest in artificial intelligence and related technology. 
 Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor of Information Technology or Engineering (Software) or Masters of Computer Science.
Why Safe Financial?
This is an exciting time for our business – we are experiencing strong and continued growth and want a team player who loves to brainstorm with colleagues on improvements for the business but also still loves getting involved in the details and making those changes. This role is based in our office in Southport. We offer a competitive salary, flexible hours, company supplied car parking and membership to EMF gym.
If this sounds like the role you have been looking for please submit your resume with a cover letter outlining why you feel this is the role for you. No phone calls or emails please.

Could this be one of those rare moments to do the best work of your career?

The Lottery Corporation is Australia's largest lottery company offering exciting games that deliver life-changing wins to customers and make a meaningful difference in the community.

We're the team who bring you Australia's favourite lottery games. For more than a century, we've been playing our role in making a better future by delivering winning moments every day to our people, our customers, retailers, partners and our community.

Share joy, spark possibilities and join the winning team today!

Note - This is a part-time role, working 30 hours per week. Due to the nature of the role, you'll be required to predominantly work from our Brisbane office with some flexibility to support work from home.

What you'll do
Assist with rostering and allocation of tasks to the Assurance staff, including compilation of casual staff timesheets;
Coordinating and undertaking independent scrutiny of Lotteries, Keno, and promotional draws to ensure integrity and compliance with regulatory and licensing conditions;
Assist with the investigation and scrutiny of major prizes, including actioning of Assurance monitoring alerts;
Perform routine updates of Assurance forms, work instructions, checklists, documents, policies and procedures - as required; and
Ensure that all Assurance contractors and supplier invoices are duly paid on time.
What you'll bring
Experience in audit, assurance or finance is beneficial;
Meticulous attention to detail;
Previous experience in a similar role;
Strong communication skills; and
Knowledge or desire to learn about gaming products and lotteries.
What you'll get
Not only will you receive an awesome candidate experience from our caring Talent team, the benefits of working with us are pretty good too!

The list is extensive but here are a few:
Join an amazing team who are ready to welcome you and set you up for success. Our people are warm, engaging and passionate. We love what we do and have fun along the way.
Deliver extraordinary results while balancing work and life with our flex for great outcomes approach
Find your balance with a variety of leave types such cultural leave, flexi-leave, volunteer leave, purchased leave and 18 weeks' parental leave for all new parents, regardless of gender or family type
A true sense of belonging. We're committed to Inclusion & Diversity with a range of initiatives such as our Gender Affirmation Statement of Support, employee inclusion networks and diversity memberships
Feel valued with experiences that are tailored to you, we'll always start from a 'yes'
Support your health and wellbeing with our comprehensive (and free) app called to support you and your family's mental and physical health
Make positive impacts with opportunities to volunteer with our community partners. We'll also dollar match fundraising efforts of our employees lending their support to registered charities
Ignite your potential with our dedicated learning and development platform with resources from leadership to technology to support your bright future
Maximise your home workspace with our home office reimbursement payment
About The Lottery Corporation
The Lottery Corporation Limited (ASX: TLC) is Australia's leading lottery company with licences and approvals to operate in each Australian state and territory, except Western Australia.

Best known for The Lott and Keno, we're proudly one of the highest-performing lottery businesses in the world.

For more than a century, we've been supporting Australian communities through lottery taxes, donations, and partnerships. We play our role in making a better future by delivering winning moments every day to our people, our customers, retailers, partners, and our community.

Studies have shown that people from under-represented backgrounds are less likely to apply for roles where they don't match the job description criteria exactly. If this role is of interest to you and you're ready to spark possibilities with The Lottery Corporation, but don't feel that your experience aligns 100%, we would still love to hear from you and encourage you to apply.

We're committed to providing a safe, respectful and supportive work environment where our people feel included and rewarded. This commitment extends to our recruitment process. We encourage candidates to let us know if we can make any accommodations, so the process can be more user friendly for them.

We acknowledge and pay respect to the traditional custodians of the lands on which our offices, retail outlets and venues operate. We acknowledge the inextricable link First Peoples of Australia have with the land past, present and future.

Your online safety is important to us. We'll never request payment or credit card details from you to apply for a position at The Lottery Corporation. The most reliable source for available opportunities at The Lottery Corporation is our website. If you're uncertain whether a job ad is legitimate, do not provide your details. Verify via our website or contact our company.

Passionate About Finding Solutions? We Are Too!
At Finance One, we're anything but ordinary. As a leading non-bank lender, we pride ourselves on being a solution-based, people-focused organisation that truly cares about making credit accessible in a personalised way. We're not just lenders; we're passionate problem solvers, redefining the lending experience with care and understanding.
The Opportunity:
If you’re a seasoned credit professional from a bank, non-bank, vehicle finance, or unregulated lending background, we want you on our credit team!
We’re looking for Credit Analysts ready to make an impact and be part of something special.
• Do you excel in credit assessments and have a delegated lending authority?
• Have experience in consumer lending, business lending, unsecured cashflow, or low-doc loans?
• Want to join a collaborative team that celebrates success, supports growth, and has fun along the way?
Why Finance One?
We’re a trailblazing non-bank lender providing solutions-based lending with flexibility and authenticity. We have an incredible team based in Townsville, a vibrant community with stunning beaches, outdoor activities, and a friendly atmosphere. Whether you’re already here, considering relocating, or looking for a city with an amazing lifestyle, join us! We’re flexible with start dates to work with your timeline, welcoming applicants from surrounding regions too.
How You Will Contribute:
• Assess and Approve Loans: Use your expertise to evaluate diverse credit applications and make empowered decisions.
• Collaborate and Communicate: Work with the sales team and brokers, collaborating on applications and fostering future opportunities.
• Drive Solutions: Help customers achieve their financial goals, delivering exceptional service and building strong collaborative relationships.
• Compliance First: Ensure all decisions align with our policies and regulatory standards.
What You'll Love About Us:
We work hard, but we know how to have a good time. From dress-up days to team lunches, our culture is about teamwork, inclusivity, and genuine appreciation for one another.
Perks include:
• Employee Investment Opportunities
• Access to Free and Confidential Counselling
• Subsidised Gym Membership
• Discounted Private Health Insurance
• Ongoing Training and Development
What We're Looking For:
• Minimum of 2 years in consumer credit analysis or SME/business lending.
• Expertise in regulated and/or unregulated lending (bank, non-bank, vehicle finance, unsecured loans, low-doc loans, mortgage loans etc.).
• Previously held a delegated lending authority.
• Strong attention to detail, divergent thinking, excellent communication and customer service passion.
• Solution-focused, flexible, and collaborative mindset with a drive to exceed KPIs and contribute to team success.
• Qualifications in accounting, banking, or finance are highly regarded.
Apply Today!
Ready to elevate your career in a growing non-bank lending environment? Submit your application via Seek with your CV and Cover Letter.
Start Date: We’re flexible - we want the best talent and are happy to work with you to make it happen!
Successful candidates must be ready to undergo a National Police Check and relevant industry checks.

12 Month Contract
Paying between $900-$1000 per day inc super
Flexible WFH - Not fully remote - Located close to the CBD

What you'll be doing:

The objective of the Senior Business Analyst role is to support transformational, business as usual and technology delivery activities by eliciting and documenting business requirements in collaboration with business Subject Matter Experts (SMEs). Specifically, you will support the eMRO (Fleet Management & Aircraft Maintenance) Project which will see the transition from a legacy on-prem solution to a Vendor hosted cloud solution for our Engineering team.

This will involve drafting test cases and scripts, participating in later stage testing e.g. User Acceptance and Business Verification Testing, supporting development of business cases and strategy documents, and performing analysis of business problems.

You'll be great in this role if you.
Have relevant qualifications in information systems or equivalent experience
Bring over 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst, with the ability to design and lead workshops with stakeholders, including creating agendas and setting clear goals
Are skilled in using Lean Six Sigma to improve processes and increase efficiency
Have experience in documenting processes, mapping business workflows, and writing clear user stories that help guide projects
Can effectively analyse business problems, turning them into clear requirements and solutions within airline systems, ensuring they meet project goals
Understand IT systems architecture, enabling you to integrate and optimise solutions, with detailed specifications gathered from stakeholder workshops
Have a strong grasp of the project lifecycle, ensuring best practices are followed and that workshops and project milestones are completed on time
Can build strong relationships with stakeholders, including executive leadership, and engage them effectively during workshops to understand their needs and challenges
Capable of analysing and documenting user requirements and processes, incorporating workshop outputs, process maps, and data to ensure high-quality, traceable deliverables

Desirable but not essential...
Master's degree in IT or Computer Science
Previous experience working in aviation
2 - 5 years' experience of leadership experience
Understanding of IT security protocols

If you are interested in this role please apply below, alternatively you can email your CV to ziomi.warchalowski@talentinternational.com.

About TMR:
Transport and Main Roads' (TMR) vision is to create a single integrated network accessible to everyone. We are delivery focused, united by our purpose to make a difference to the lives of Queenslanders. Every day is different and so are our teams. We foster an inclusive workplace culture and will support you to grow and develop in your career while maintaining a healthy work-life balance.

Responsibilities:
We recognise and celebrate that everyone is unique and seek the applicant best suited to the role. We will assess your experience, knowledge and acquired skills, as well as your potential for development and your personal qualities.

To thrive in this role, you will need to demonstrate the following:
• Proven experience in interpreting and analysing large, complex data sets from various sources such as systems, cloud connections and databases and using tools like Excel, Tableau, Power BI to prepare accurate, high-quality spreadsheets, dashboards, reports and presentations.
• Demonstrated expertise in crafting clear, concise key messages from program analysis, delivering high quality, accurate written or verbal advice to support senior executive decision-making, and preparing materials for non-technical external audiences, including Ministerial briefings, departmental correspondence, parliamentary questions, and media releases.
• Strong ability to cultivate and maintain effective relationships with key internal stakeholders across the department and external partners, including Queensland Treasury and the Department of State Development and Infrastructure.
• Highly proficient time management and organisational skills, with a proven ability to adapt to changing priorities and consistently deliver high-quality results.
• Provide technical leadership to enhance team capability by sharing knowledge and promoting best practices in data reporting and analysis.
Additional Benefits this role offers:
• Work and Life balance, including 'flex time' and flexible work arrangements and a working from home option.
• Beautiful City location close to the Brisbane Botanical Gardens and public and active transport.
• Work with a supportive team, with a high level of training and development invested in each staff member.
• Generous leave and superannuation.
